loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy is a 36-year-old mother of three. She provides services in her beauty center. She is very grateful to the practice and experience she has gained. It has allowed her to create her own work space in her home. There is a great demand for her services, and thus she has decided to relocate to establish a comprehensive center that will meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucy de 36 años es madre de tres hijos, se dedica a brindar servicios en su centro de belleza e imagen personal, gracias a la práctica y experiencia que ganó puso en su propio domicilio su centro de trabajo.Posee una gran demanda y ha decidido mudarse para poner un centro de belleza integral, con todos y cada uno de los servicios que hoy en día solicitan sus clientes.

loans.use: To rent a larger space to establish her new work center

loans.name: Cori Sandra

texts.es:
The lady Cori belongs to “Las Shipibas” Communal Bank, located on Jr. Calleria 445 of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and a single woman. With the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Branches Cori decided to invest in a small store of hair colors.

Currently her business has grown. She rises very early to attend her business. With the cordial and kind treatment that she gives her clients, they remain very satisfied.

With this loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy colors of different brands, shampoos, creams, cosmetics, etc.

Cori is a very enterprising young woman. With her loans she is paying for her studies and capitalizing on her business in order to be able to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cori pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Calleria 445, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años, es soltera. Cori con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña tienda de tintes para el pelo.

En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio, con el trato amable y cordial que da sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tintes de diferentes marcas, champús, cremas, cosméticos, etc.

Cori es una joven muy emprendedora, con sus prestamos esta pagando sus estudios, y capitalizándose en su negocio para así poder seguir progresando.

loans.use: To buy hair colors, cosmetics, creams, shampoo, etc for her business.

loans.name: Nimu

texts.en:
Mrs. Nimu A., 40 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kulashwor in Kathmandu. She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouses, Ladies long dresses, Makhshi (long ladies’ dresses) and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. A. took a 6 month training course in tailoring.

Mrs. A. plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education. Her husband's name is Kapil Dev A. and he is a taxi driver. She has two daughters.The youngest daughter is in grade 2 and the oldest daughter is in grade 4.

loans.use: Nimu would like to buy raw material for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Numon

texts.en:
B. Numon is 53 years old. He is married with 5 children.
Numon provides taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for about 20 years and it is the main source of income for his large family. Numon works hard, he gets up early and goes to bed late, trying not to lose any client. The business is successful and generates stable income for Numon's large family and his mother and father. However, the business also needs some funding. Numon plans to fix his car to provide higher quality services to make more profit in order to send his daughter to university. Numon requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 9 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. He thanks all for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Alawia

texts.en:
Alawia is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 6, 4, and 7 months. She has sold juice since 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.
 
Alawia is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Amina's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Amina, 47, married with five children ranging in age from 24 to 14, has been a milk seller since 2001. She works daily from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Amina is now requesting a loan to buy more milk for resale in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in clothing sales, juice sales and tailoring services.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen H. is a widowed farmer and lives with four of her children in the Prey Veng, Cambodia. She grows various kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make about US$8 each day. She is aided by two of her children who are employed by an organization in the village. Two other children are students. She said on average, she spends around US$45 on food and US$25 on children's education.

Chen H. has requested a loan from Kiva via CREDIT, a local partner, for US$1200 to breed cows for sale. For her future plans, she wants to breed more cows for sale, as well as to produce baby cows. She said she will work hard for her children's education. She also plans to build a new house.

loans.use: To breed cows for sale.

loans.name: Utkir

texts.en:
A. Utkir is 28 years old, married and has two kids. Utkir was born and raised in Shahristan, Tajikistan, where he cultivates wheat and different kinds of vegetables. He has worked in agriculture for many years and gained much experience. Utkir's large family helps him with his business. He lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters. Utkir dreams of having his own house as his children are growing up. He worries about their future. 

He will invest his loan of 500 (150 USD) in buying fuel, lubricants, and bags for the upcoming potato planting season. With the help of a loan he can earn more income and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase bags, fuel, and lubricants

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is 28 years old, married, and has one small son. She sells women's underwear and bathrobes at Vasilievka market. Her working capital is 16,000 UAH.

Olesya is new to business. She only started six months ago. She was advised to start business by her sister, who sells her goods in the next booth and has more experience in business. Her sister helped her to get the loan and gives some advice as to what to buy and how to sell. 

Olesya is a hardworking and responsible person. She believes she can make her business grow. Olesya would like to get a loan of 1,500 UAH for six weeks to buy more women's underwear to sell during the Christmas season. She hopes to receive additional income and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Greetings from Ildephonse M. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Ildephonse is 40 years old, married with 4 children.

Mr. M. operates a shop selling various food items such as beans, maize, etc. This entrepreneur hires a small truck, which helps him to carry his products to his store.

He is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf that will help him to increase his stock because he has got new customers in town. Furthermore, he says that this loan will increase his profit and will enable him to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of food products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA R. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol Naciente”, ubicado en el Jr. Jhon F. Kennedy N° 1085 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 62 años D. edad, 01 hijo, su esposo compra madera y venD..

Su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un poco D. triplay confeccionó esteras y ponía a la ventalos pollos que criaba, poco a poco sus clientes solicitaban más el producto.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 compró 500 pollos bb y sus alimentos, virutas, para que se calienten los pollitos, pero continúa con la confección D. esteras.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
ROSA R. D. R. is a member of the “Sol Naciente” microfinance institute, located on John F. Kennedy Street N° 1085, in the district of Callería. She is 62 years old, has 1 son, and her husband buys and sells lumber for a living.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased a bit of three-ply, maD. mats, and sold the chickens that she was raising. Little by little, her customers kept requesting her products.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she purchased 500 chicks and wood shavings to keep them warm. She is still making mats as well. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 500 chicks and wood shavings

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita C., 40, married, is a residnet of  Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is engaged in fish vending for the past two years.  Her business started with a small amount of money she borrowed from her relatives. Later, she was  able to access  a loan from HSPFI.  Mercedita needs additiona capital amounting to  PHP11,000 to increase the volume of her sales. She aspires to become a rice trader and a soft-drink dealer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  fish  for  sale.

loans.name: Cordelia

texts.en:
Cordelia sells foodstuffs and drinks. She hopes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers.

She needs the loan amount of N70000 to purchase a generator and a deep freezer. This, she says, will enable her meet the demands of her customers.

She is 38 years old and married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and a generator

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn C. is a young business woman who perseveres a lot in order to have a progressive life. She is 23 years old and manages a hog raising business. Aside from that, she also engages in direct selling to further support the feed supply of her hogs.

She strives so hard so she can help her parents send her other siblings to school. Now, for the continuous operation of her small enterprises, she requests a loan of PHP 4,000 for additional business capital. She is very optimistic that she will become successful in the business even though there are many competitors.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte A. is 22 years old. She is single and she lives with her mother and younger siblings in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Charlotte works to make some income to provide for the family.  She supports her mother financially and helps meet her younger siblings’ demands.

She is a trader. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies, doughnuts, and chips. Charlotte distributes to retailers in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure food in bulk for distribution to retailers

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Neema N. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 11 years old. Neema has been running a maize business since 2007. Neema’s business is to sell maize from the village to town at a higher price. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 159USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase maize and to increase her stock. In the future, she plans to open another business. Neema thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize to increase her stock.

loans.name: Sehar Zafar Asghar Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Another Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Ameer baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business.

Sehar baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all belong to a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines. They all are very responsible and hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses and support their families. Sehar baji operates a business sewing clothes to pay for utilities. Her husband works in a factory for a monthly wage. Sehar baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she is able to complete orders on time and earn a good income.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina sells eggs and sarongs. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more eggs and sarongs to sell. She is thankful for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
KOUSSOUHO Reine est mère de deux enfants, âgés de trois ans et de  six mois.  Reine est mariée à NOUDJENOUNME  Jean, qui est chauffeur de taxi.  Reine habite avec sa famille à Cotonou, la ville la plus grande du Bénin.  

À Cotonou, Reine vend  de tomates, piments, oignons, légumes, qui sont utilisés pour préparer les sauces des plats Béninois.  Reine vend dans sa boutique au bord de la rue.  Reine achète ses produits au Marché Houejbo à Cotonou.  Dans le future, Reine voudrait vendre ses produits en gros, mais actuellement Reine n’a pas les moyens financiers nécessaire.  Pour augmenter le volume de son activité, Reine cherche un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
KOUSSOUHO Reine is the mother of two children, ages six months to 3 years old. She is married to NOUDJENOUNME Jean, a taxi driver, and lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin. In Cotonou, Reine sells tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, and legumes that are used in making sauces for Beninese dishes. She sells in a shop on the roadside. She buys her goods at the Houejbo Market in Cotonou. In the future, she would like to sells her goods wholesale, but currently she does not have the necessary financial means. To increase her business volume, Reine is seeking a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret G. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Margaret sells clothes and shoes in Abura, which she has done since 1991. She carries the clothing on the head and moves from place to place selling them. Her husband is a driver. Margaret uses her income to pay fees and buy clothing for the children. Margaret will use the loan to buy more shoes and clothes for resale. Margaret plans to re-invest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone I. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Satapuala. She is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Leone makes and sells baked goods in the local community. Leone has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

Leone joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leone has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Leone is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Leone's 3rd loan from SPBD. Leone plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Olímpia Vânia

texts.pt:
Olímpia Vânia nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 24 anos de idade, freqüentou a 10 classe, solteira e mãe de um filho de 6anos. Para alem do filho, sustente seu sobrinho e uma irmã sob sua responsabilidade.  

Em 1992 saiu de Maputo para viver na Matola juntamente com sua família, onde se encontra até então.
Olímpia é comerciante a tempo inteiro, dona do seu negócio. Trabalha a 4 anos sozinha e sem empregados.

Aprendeu através de uma Senhora amiga em Maputo já tem 8 anos de experiência de. Vende roupa de cama e outros artigos de tecido (Duves, lençóis, cortinas e outros artigos). Compra uma parte dos produtos na áfrica do sul a 1.500,00MT e vende a 3.000,00MT. O seu rendimento mensal é de 12.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e ainda poupa algum valor no final de Mês. Não tem casa própria.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 11.000,00MT. Pretende comprar diversos artigos de tecido (lençóis, duves, cortinas e outros). Nunca teve outros empréstimos noutras instituições, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema graças a uma amiga que tinha levantado Credito na instituição. Ela acha que o seu negocio poderá crescer com o aumento de volume de mercadoria.

 São desafios os custos aduaneiros bem como os próprios funcionários das alfândegas que podem desviar seus produtos quando ela não tem valores para poder pagar. Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas. Com o sucesso do negocio pensa em construir casa própria e responder as necessidades da família que tanto precisa e para tal conta com kiva para mais empréstimos.
Projeta, para futuro, r ser médica e proprietária de um salão de cabeleireiro.
texts.en:
Olímpia Vânia was born in the city of Maputo. She is 24 years old. She attended school until 10th grade, and she's the single mother of a 6-year-old boy. In addition to her son, she also supports her nephew and a sister. In 1992 she left Maputo to live in Matola with her family, and she's still there. Olímpia is a full-time shopkeeper, owner of her own business. She's worked for four years by herself, without any employees. She learned business from a friend in Maputo and has 8 years of experience. She sells bedsheets and other cloth goods (duvets, handkerchiefs, curtains, etc.). She buys some of her products in South Africa at 1500 meticals and sells them at 3000 meticals. She earns 12,000 meticals a month, which she uses to support her family. She is also able to save a little each month. This is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 11,000 meticals. She will use it to stock her store. She's never had loans from other institutions. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through a friend who had received a loan from the organization. She believes her business will be able to expand with an increase in the quantity and variety of goods she stocks. Customs fees are a major challenge, since customs officials can send deny her products entry when she doesn't have the money to pay them. She intends to pay back her loan in full without any problems. With her business's success, she hopes to build her own house and meet her family's needs. She is counting on Kiva for additional loans. It the future, she'd like to be a doctor and own a beauty salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Akkajja Omunaku Nabojjo Lonah Group

texts.en:
Lonah N. is forty-five years old. She is married and has seven children. She also cares for four dependents, three of whom go to school. 

Lonah has been selling rice for over three years. She is requesting a loan to add capital to her rice business so she can increase her stock and her profits. She is a promising, hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C., age 42, is a vendor of various food items, such as tomatoes and paste. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase onions to sell in addition to her current offerings. Poni's husband is a businessman. They have nine children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to be able to pay tuition fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase onions to sell

loans.name: Kofi Yves

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme exerce le commerce de liqueur, plus précisément la vente de boissons locales alcoolisées dénommées « sodabi ». Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2006 dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Il vend le plus souvent en gros à des revendeurs de liqueurs fortes. Ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins de base. Avec le temps, il s’est rendu compte que c’est un commerce très florissant. Il s’approvisionne à Ahépé, localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. La plupart de ses clients apprécient la qualité de sa boisson. Il veut expressément renouveler son stock presque inexistant ; pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 tonneaux de sodabi. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This young man runs a liquor store, more specifically he sells popular local alcoholic drinks called "sodabi". He started this business in 2006 in the Attiegou district in Lome. He sells wholesale most of the time to liquor retailers. This business lets him take charge and he can afford the necessities of life. With time he realised that his business is very profitable. He buys his supply in Ahepe, located many kilometres from Lome. Most of his clients like the quality of his product. He wants very much to replenish his stock because he is almost completely out. For this he is requesting a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) so that he will be able to purchase 5 barrels of sodabi. He is single and he has no children.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: Bashiru is 32-years old and married with a child. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He sells oil and crack palm cannel, which is a cleaning and sanitizing agent.  He is requesting a loan for $675 so he can purchase more inventory and service more customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm cannel to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Mrs. Alma E. is from the village of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 36 years old, is married, and is blessed with two school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a poultry business. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years earning 3,000 PHP monthly income. In 2009, Alma joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her first loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her poultry

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” del distrito y provincia de Azángaro, es  madre soltera y tiene a su cuidado a sus 02 hijos.  Tiene 60 años de edad y viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año y medio, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria.

Ella actualmente se dedica a  la venta de productos de pasamanería como ganchos, detergentes, jabones, etc. y tiene una puesto en el mercado de Azángaro.
El primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 500.00, el cual invirtió en la compra de productos para incrementar su mercadería

Con este crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más productos como ganchos, jabón, detergente y así poder seguir vendiendo, para generar sus propios ingresos.

Su visión  para el futuro es poder viajar y poder visitar a sus familiares.

Lo que mas le gusta  son los encuentros deportivos que se realizan a nivel de Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Azangarinas Valientes" from the district and province Azangaro. She is a single mother and takes care of her 2 children. She is 60 years old and began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos one and a half years ago. She studied up to her junior year of high school. She currently sells trimmings or decorative fringes such as hooks, detergents, soaps, etc. She has a stall in the Azangaro market. The first loan she requested was S /. 500.00, which she invested in purchasing products to increase her merchandise. With this credit of S /. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying more products, such as hooks, soap, and detergent, and thus, will be able to continue selling to generate her own income. Her vision for the future is to be able to travel and visit her relatives. What she likes most are the sport matches that are taking place at the communal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hooks, soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Llanilda

texts.es: Lianilda M. es una socia colaboradora y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 30 años y es madre de dos hijos. Lianilda se dedica a la venta de pescados y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte público. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace cinco años, donde es muy querida por las demás socias. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en en la compra de pescado para vender. En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles los que le permitirán invertir en la compra de una red para pescar. La meta de Lianilda es tener un bote para pescar y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lianilda M. is a cooperative and hardworking member of the “Madres Corajes” [Courageous Mothers] Communal Bank. She has been a member for five years and is much loved by the other members. She is 30 years old and a mother of two.

Lianilda is a fish seller and she counts on the support of her husband who is in public transport. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was invested in fish to sell. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to buy a fishing net. Her goal is to have her own fishing boat, and continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a fishing net

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda M. is a 38-year-old CEVI client from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is tills a small rice field that she inherited from her parents. She also has two children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is only two years old. She started her business in 2000. Until now, she has maintained her crop to provide her family with adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to borrow Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest and her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es:
el señor Marco Aurelio D. S. tiene 36 años de edad, su esposa es la sra. Maria S. Mejia, quien se dedica al cuidado de sus 3 hijos, mientras Marco vende achineria en el mercado municipal de Langue, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, esta actividad le a servido para sostener su familia. su meta es comprar su propio puesto en el mercado municipal.
aqui es dificil conseguir un puesto pero tiene fe en que pronto lo va a conseguir.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mejores ganancias.
tiene que viajar para poder comprar su mercaderia y esto le dificulta a el ya que cuando lo hace compra poco y tiene que estar viajando mas seguido y esto le ocaciona mas gastos. por tal razon necesita el credito para comprar mas mercadia.
texts.en:
Marco Aurelio D. S. is 36, and his wife is Maria Santo Mejia. She devotes herself to taking care of their three children while Marco sells home items and novelties in the Langue municipal market. He has been in this type of business for three years. It has served to support his family. His goal is to buy his own stall in the municipal market. It is difficult to get a stall here, but he has faith that he will soon do it. He needs the loan to buy more merchandise and get better earnings. He has to travel to be able to buy his merchandise. This is difficult for him because when he buys, it is a small amount. Then he has to travel again soon, and this causes more expenses. That is the reason he needs a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy porcelin decorations, glass decorations, soaps, soft drinks, light bulbs, batteries, candles, and picture frames

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en: Erickson is a 31-year-old man who runs a butcher shop that employs four people. His other source of income is a barber shop, which he also operates. With the Kes. 80,000 loan, Erickson wants to open other outlets of his butcher shop. He hopes to someday open a meat processing plant. Erickson describes himself as an aggressive businessman.

loans.use: To open other outlets of his butcher shop

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 55 years old and married with eight children between the ages of 2 and 27. Six of them are attending school. She is a farmer near Kisii in southwestern Kenya and has been farming for 16 years. She grows onions, cabbages and plants and sells them in the local market. She says that the main challenge to her business is the small market for her perishable goods.

Rael requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the money from milk sales she can pay her children's school fees and have a healthy family. In the future, she hopes to acquire more training in dairy farming and expand to have five good dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy C., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Chhun, 42, have been married since 1989 and have three sons, all of whom are in school. They live along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. Thy has been a construction worker for three years while his wife has been a garment factory worker for five years.

Thy does not have transportation for commuting to work and it’s difficult for him because he has to spend a lot of money for traveling cost. Facing this, Thy is asking for his first loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

This couple hopes to support their children’s further education so that they have good jobs when they finish their studying.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath O. is a villager in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. She was born in 1954. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to support her family. She is also a pig breeder. At present, she is a widow who lives with her four children. One of her children is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are laborers who take care of some ducks and earn a small salary, and one is attending a local public school. However they try to work hard, they can not support this family. Thus, Mrs. Sambath O. decided to ask for a loan to make more money to purchase a cow to breed.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to breed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria L. is from the village of Iligan city. She is 54 years old. Gloria is married and has five adult children. Gloria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulana Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
At the start of N. Sauda’s produce and wholesale business in 2003, somebody laid a bet that her business would not see the light of day after a month’s course. The skepticism was a no-brainer to her, as she had set out her objectives to succeed by then. She had to bring her guts and determination to bear in the face of such low expectations from some of her disparaging friends.

With huge reserves of optimism and with a desire to prove her detractors wrong, 35-year-old Sauda embarked on her mission – to get established in the business genre of her preference, to wit: a produce sales and small commodity wholesale business. She went out of her depth to fight off the early financial quagmires that had reared their heads and were making her chances of success hang in the balance.

Sauda started getting into her stride when she began selling rice, groundnuts (peanuts), beans and millet. When her prospects began improving, her down-the-line attitude got even better. As a consequence, all her three children, who were hitherto not going to school, began attending school.

Sauda’s customers are mostly small retailers. In a month, she says she earns to the tune of 600,000 shillings. She is also a counselor within her locality. With this loan she wants to buy some produce she has not sold before like coffee and cotton. She also wants to buy more matches, textbooks and tea leaves for her wholesale stock.

loans.use: To purchase crops such as coffee that she has not sold before and also some wholesale stock

loans.name: Llankasunchis De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Llankasunchis de Lares” se reúnen cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Lares. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 9 y está conformado por  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La palabra quechua “Llankasunchis” que traducido al castellano significa “Trabajemos”.   
	
Paulina, tiene 37 años, tiene dos gemelos de 12 años que estudian en la escuela. 

Paulina nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Llankasunchis”  somos 12  integrantes (8 mujeres y 4 varones) y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Paulina tiene un restaurante en la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Lares “Las Gemelas” donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo, cena y comida a pedido del cliente. Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo  azúcar, arroz, papas, verduras, carnes, etc. 

Sus principales  actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son  a las ventas de  comida de forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas de lares que se llama “Asociación de Vianderas de comunidad de Lares”, crianza y venta de animales menores, venta de comestibles, venta de chicha y frutillada y otros socios brindan servicios en la municipalidad de distrital de Lares. Su actividad económica complementaria es la ganadería y la agricultura, ellos venden sus productos en la feria de “Machacancha” los lunes hasta las 2 de la tarde y después se trasladan a vender a la feria de “Cachin” los días martes.           

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Llankasunchis de Lares” meet every 30 days in the micro finance offices of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Lares. The community bank is in their ninth loan cycle and is made of up laborers and entrepreneurs who take every chance they get to get ahead and through their daily efforts strive to improve the future of their children. The quechua word "Llankasunchis” means "workers". Paulina is 37 years old and has two 12 year old twins who are attending school. Paulina told us - My community bank "Llankasunchis” is made up of 12 members (8 women and 4 men). They elected me to represent the community bank and describe my economic activities. Paulina has a restaurant call "Las Gemelas" in the the Plaza de Armas in the city of Lares where she prepares breakfast, lunch, dinner, and food specially ordered by her clients. Paulina requires the loan to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc. Some of the principle economic activities that members of the community bank engage in are: the sale of food on foot in the Plaza de Armas in Lares for the “Asociación de Vianderas de comunidad de Lares”, growing and selling young animals, grocery sales, sale of chicha (corn liquor) and fruit and others offer services in the municipal district of Lares. They complement each others activities because they all work with cattle and agriculture and sell their products in the market of “Machacancha” on Mondays until 2 in the afternoon and then relocate to the “Cachin” market on Tuesdays. The community bank members value the loan and are very grateful. They will pay the loan down according to the terms agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paulina requires the loan to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Katherin Rosmeri

texts.es: Katherin tiene 22 años  de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, vive en la casa de su madre, casa  cercada de madera. Ella se dedica  a la venta de pollo en el mercado la union en puesto de su madre. Ella se dedica  a este negocio hace 5 años , se inicio desde muy joven apoyando a su madre en el mismo rubro de negocio, ella es un persona muy joven el cual tine muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder tener su negocio mucho mas grande. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en surtir su mercaderia con la venta de huevos.
texts.en:
Katherin, 22, is a single mother with one son 5 years old. She lives in her mother's home, a home surrounded by woods. She sells chicken in the La Union market in her mother's place. She has done this business for 5 years, having begun helping her mother in the same type of business when she was very young. She is a very young person who has many dreams and goals, one of which is to have her business be much larger. With the money she has requested, she will enlarge her offerings with egg sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales merchandise

loans.name: Miriam Ruth

texts.es:
MIRIAM
Esfuerzo y dedicacion es lo que Miriam demuestra ya que empezo su trabajo vendiendo cosmeticos por catalogo cuando su hijo era aun pequeño, Poco a poco comenzo a incrementar su negocio y comenzo a vender bebidas como: cervezas y gaseosas. Cuando quedo embarazada por segunda vez aperturo una bodega en casa donde pudo descansar un poco, Ese negocio lo mantiene hasta ahora y la ayuda a pagar los gastos familiares. Ella tiene como objetivo ampliar su tienda ademas le gustaria estudiar un curso de enfermeria para poder ejercerlo y tener mayores ingresos. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
When her son was younger, Miriam demonstrated effort and dedication as she started her business selling cosmetics through catalogs. She gradually expanded her business and began selling beverages such as beer and sodas. When she became pregnant for the second time, Miriam opened a store in her home so that she would have time to rest. She continues to maintain this business since it helps her pay for the family expenses. Miriam intends to expand her store and also begin studying nursing so that she can pursue this profession and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena G. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Elena is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Elena runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Elena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma G. is from the village of Poblacion, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a bakeshop, baking and selling a variety of staple products including bread in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy good quality wood for carpentry.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 53 años, vive en alquiler  en el Barrio/15 de julio zona Radial 26 final. Es separado de su esposa tiene 5 hijos la cual vive con la hija menor quien le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, trabaja como  Contratista hace 30 años. El credito que se le otorgo al cliente será destinado para la construccion de un cuarto ya que el cuenta con un lote propio, comprara material de construccion como cemento, ladrillos, tejas, yeso,etc. El Sr. Mario quedo muy satisfecho y a la vez agradecio por la confianza que depositaron en él, y la facilidad que  se le otorgo el credito .
texts.en:
Mario, 53, rents his home in 15 de Julio, Zona Radial 26 Final neighborhood. He is separated from his wife and has 5 children. He lives with his youngest daughter who helps him with household expenses. He has been working as a contractor for 30 years. The loan granted will be used to build a room on a lot that he owns. He will buy building materials and supplies like: cement, bricks, roof tiles, plaster, etc. Mario was very grateful for and at the same time very satisfied with the trust that was placed in him and the ease with which the loan was granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes;  La socia tiene 32 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia ayuda en el taller de carpintería a su esposo, ella da los acabados finales, ella pule, laquea, y pinta algunos detalles que se le pida. La socia quiere apoyar a implementar junto a su esposo y teniendo un ahorro guardado para la compra de una maquina cepilladora para el taller. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian Community Bank; this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco department. Mrs. Lourdes is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. She works helping in her husband's carpentry shop. She makes all the final touches. She shines, applies lacquer, and paints detailing if requested. She and her husband plan on using their savings to purchase a planing machine for their shop. She is applying for the loan to purchase merchandise for their business. She is thankful and values the loan made available through this medium. She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for carpentry business

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is the mother of three daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter is a seamstress and sews clothes for neighborhood clients. Her son works in a government sector and does sewing work part-time. Her younger daughters are in fifth and second standards. Kaneez’s husband is a retired government officer and spends his time at home. The family lives in a small village named Hayyatabad within the city of Chichawatni. Chichawatni is famous for its agricultural industry.

Kaneez is a very helping lady by nature. She assists her daughter in completing customers’ orders with her sewing. She always supports her daughter and guides her in making new designs for dresses. Sewing has become the family business because most of its members are involved in this work.

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son who wants to improve his sewing business by buying an electric sewing machine that will help him work better and fulfill large orders on time. He has five years of experience in the sewing business, and Kaneez is confident that he will get good results from his business after this investment.

Kaneez is a regular client of Asasah and is in her third loan cycle. In the previous loan periods she has proved herself as a responsible client who has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photograph the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Kaneez.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto O. is 41 years old and manages a small rice farm. He has been growing rice for eight years. He has enough experience already and wishes to improve his harvest. He says that, by tilling the farm, he can earn 42,000 Philippines pesos (Php) from the harvest. Farming is what he relies on for his family's daily basic needs.

He would like to apply for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., a Kiva partner. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest. He likes the CEVI program because it doesn’t only provide loans, but education as well for all of them.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sitou

texts.fr: sitou est  une femme célibataire très dynamique, pour subvenir à ses propres  besoins elle a commencé l’activité de cambiste c'est-à-dire l’échange de devises. elle souhaite accroître son capital pour gagner plus de revenu elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit devant lui permettre d’accroître son revenu. Cette activité est très rentable à lomé. elle vend aussi des produits de premières nécessités
texts.en:
Sitou is a very energetic single woman. In order to support herself, she started a foreign currency exchange brokerage business. 

She would like to increase her capital in order to earn more income. She is thus requesting her first loan from WAGES that should allow her to increase her income. This business is very profitable in Lomé. She also sells staple goods.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the town of Veruela. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia's husband, who is also a farmer, has a part-time job in a welding shop. Delia said she and her husband do their best to provide for their family's needs.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is a Nairobi-based businessman. He is a landlord who has developed several semi-permanent residential houses that he rents out. His customers are mainly middle income earners. He has been in this business for the last four years. He is married and, in partnership with his wife, Shem runs a grocery store. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to install water pipes and repaint his rental houses. He is a risk taker and also hardworking and hopes to build more permanent houses in the future. Since joining Faulu, his business has grown and he has been able to take care of his family.

loans.use: to install water pipes and repaint his rental houses

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old. Marlon is married and has an infant. To make a living, Marlon owns and operates a business which provides transportation services.  Marlon has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be Marlon's first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
María Gladys es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito pesquero de San José, una localidad que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 28 años a brindar servicio de costura en un pequeño taller que tiene instalado en un ambiente de su vivienda. Ella suele confeccionar prendas de vestir a medida de cada uno de sus clientes, asimismo también arregla prendas de vestir deterioradas. El negocio le ayuda a sentirse activa y le permite colaborar con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María Gladys desea adquirir material para cumplir con algunos pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho por temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Gladys is a 44 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the fishing district of San José, a town in Lambayeque province, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 28 years, María Gladys has been providing a sewing service in a small workshop that she has  in her home.  She usually makes made-to-measure garments for her customers.  She also mends clothes.  Her business helps her to feel active and allows her to help support her family financially.

María Gladys would like to acquire material so that she can fill some orders that her customers have made for the Christmas season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and cooperates with his brother who works as a baker to cover the expenses of the family. He is also paying his young brother's school fees.  He has been running a clothing store since 2004. 

He opened his shop after getting the needed experience in this field almost 10 years ago. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new clothes for his shop to better serve his customers' needs. He always tries to offer new collections in his shop to attract clients and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Tynar's Group

texts.en:
Tynar J., 51, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). Unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised three sons and a daughter. All the children, except the youngest son, are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money Tynar breeds cattle and sells milk. She earns 2000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase household appliances in order to improve her living conditions. In the future, she wants to see her youngest son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances

loans.name: Los Peregrinos Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS PEREGRINOS es un banco que ya está en su tercer ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 7 Mujeres y 1 Varón y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. LUZ es la presidenta del Banco le eligieron por su responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras esta separada de su esposo, cuenta que fue un momento dificil para ella pero salio adelante por el bienestar de sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda Mano en la feria de Yungas y también viaja a distintas ferias, vive  en casa familiar, y su deseo es tener su casa propia y esta ahorrando para conseguir este deseo, con el préstamo a lograra comprar más mercadería y así incrementar su capital de trabajo de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Los Peregrinos (The Pilgrims) Investment Bank is already in its 3rd loan cycle and is composed of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man. The women are dedicated to commerce and sell clothing, among other things.

Luz is the president of the bank. She was elected because of her responsibility and solidarity with her companions. Luz is separated from her husband. She says it was a difficult moment for her but she has forged ahead for the benefit of her 3 children, all of whom are school age. Luz sells second-hand clothing at the fair in Yungas and also, travels to distant fairs. She lives in her family's house, and her desire is to have her own house. Luz is saving to achieve her desire.

With this loan, she will buy more merchandise and thereby increase her working capital. In this manner, her income and quality of life will be improved. Luz is a very hard-working person and is very grateful to the institution for the help it affords.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE (NEW AND SECOND-HAND CLOTHING) AT WHOLESALE

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 56 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos Freddy de 22 y Flor de 12 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Juana ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos de papa, maíz y arveja, gracias a todo su esfuerzo, sus cultivos son de los mejores de su poblado, motivo por el cual cuando los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que el trabajo que realizó meses atrás dio sus frutos. Lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos. En adelante, espera incrementar la cantidad que produce actualmente, para eso desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juana, age 56, is a modest hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her two beloved children, Freddy (age 22) and Flor (age 12), for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Juana works hard so that her crops of potatoes, corn, and peas can thrive. Thanks to all of her efforts, Juana’s crops are the best in her village. This explains why she quickly sells out of her products when she brings them to the city of Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her crops because she sees the fruit of her labor after many months. Going forward, Juana wants to buy more land so that she can increase the quantity that she currently produces.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Juana knows that the support she receives will help advance and develop her business. For this reason, she is willing to submit all of her payments on time. In her Communal Bank, Juana is well-liked because she is a very responsible member. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Y

texts.en: Y T. is a 35-year-old woman who lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops such as cabbages, cucumbers and rice. She sells these crops to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband grows these crops with Y T.. They have three single children, all of whom are students at the local school. Y T. will use her loan to clear a field so that she can plant more rice crops.

loans.use: To clear a field for crops

loans.name: Mariela Getzabel

texts.es: Mariela G.: casada de 26 años de edad tiene 1 hija de 3 años, tiene negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada tambien vende comida y tortillas, ella inicio su negocio desde que era muy pequeña ya que su mama para pode sacarlos adelante vendia comida y desde entonces le ha gustado vender, ella agradese Dios primero y a Fape por poder brindarle un credito para poder surtir su negocio, ella Solicita el credito para invertir en la compra de zapatos Anericanos ya que sus clientes han tenido mas demanda de productos,el sueño mas grande de ella a corto plazo es poner un local con su negocio de venta de zapatos Americanos, para no andar vendiendo ambulante y el sueño a largo plazo es ver a su hija con un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Mariela G., 26, is married and has a 3 year-old daughter.  She has a business selling new and used clothing, and she also sells food and tortillas.  She started in business when she was very young, since her mother, in order to provide for the family, used to sell food.  Ever since then she has enjoyed selling.  Mariela thanks God first and also FAPE for providing a loan so that she can stock her business.  She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of American shoes, since she has a lot of demand from her customers for these products.  Her biggest dream for the short run is to be able to have her own store where she can sell American shoes, so that she would not have to sell on the street.  Her dream for the long run is to see her daughter have a better future.

loans.use: to buy American shoes

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a 35 year old business lady. She runs a salon with one employee. She left employment five years ago and went into business. She also sells bags so as to supplement her family’s income.

She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could get finances to boost her business. Therefore, she joined Fountain group in Faulu Kenya, whose members guarantee each other loans. Through the group, she has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes. She will use the loan to buy a hair drier and bags.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier and bags.

loans.name: Jose Jacinto

texts.es:
José tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el caserío Chachupe Bajo afuera del distrito de La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. La zona en donde vive es rural y no cuenta con luz ni agua potable.

Gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores como patos, pavos, pollos y cabrero. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende al público y a los comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en este rubro. Además José trabaja como ayudante de una fundición de ollas del cual recibe un sueldo semanalmente. José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. También desea arreglar sus corrales para mejor proteger sus animales de las lluvias y presentarles sus animales a sus clientes en una manera más profesional. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose, 19, is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house in Chachupe Bajo settlement outside La Victoria District about 20 minutes from Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital; the area where he lives is rural and has neither electricity nor potable water.

He earns his living raising small farm animals, like ducks, turkeys, chickens and goats, to sell.  When his animals reach a good size and weight he sells them to the general public and to merchants that tend to visit his area.  He’s been in this line of work for over 3 years.  In addition, Jose works as an Assistant at a pot foundry earning a weekly salary.

Jose wants to repair his corrals to better protect his animals from the rain and to exhibit them to his customers in a more professional manner.  To do so, he’s thought it convenient to request a 700 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair his corrals and to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana tiene 27 años, es madre soltera, viven ella y su hijo en una casa propia en el barrio Cerro Real de la ciudad de Caacupé, distante 56 km de la capital del País, la ciudad de Asunción.
La Sra. Adriana posee una despensa y carnicería en su domicilio, debido a su excelente calidad de productos y a su dedicada atención a los clientes cuenta con una gran clientela formada, que muchas veces supera la cantidad de demanda que puede abastecer.
Por eso solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de carne en reces, de modo que pueda cumplir la demanda de su clientela y así obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar.
En el futuro desea seguir trabajando con la Fundación y Kiva para ir creciendo día a día y para asegurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana is 27 years old.  She is a single mother who lives with her son in her own home, in Cerro Real neighborhood, in the city of Caacupé, 56 km from the country's capital city Asunción.

Adriana has a grocery and butcher's store in her home.  Owing to the excellent quality of her products and her good customer service, she has a large customer base which means her demand sometimes outstrips her ability to supply.

For this reason, Adriana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can buy beef.  This will enable her to meet her customers' demands and thereby make more income for her family.

In the future, Adriana would like to continue working with Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that she can continue to grow every day and ensure the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy beef

loans.name: Jane Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jane de 46 años de edad, es soltera, vive solo en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios  de agua, y luz solamente, ubicada en Nueva Arica, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo .
Jane se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves corral  (gallinas, pavos y pollos), el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso óptimo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo,  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.
El crédito que ha solicitado Jane es de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de más aves de corral y su alimento respectivo, con la finalidad de que sus animales engorden y pueda venderlos a un buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo  le ayudara  a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Jane es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old, single, and lives alone in her own house where the only services she receives are water and electricity. Her home is in Nueva Arica, which is part of Chiclayo Province. The main businesses in this area are agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

Jane raises and sells poultry (hens, turkeys, and chickens). The animals are kept in pens that are located behind her house and she feeds them a balanced diet. When the animals have reached the optimal size and weight, she sells them at different markets in the city of Chiclayo. She has been able to increase her earnings and obtain things that were lacking in her home.

The loan Jane is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa is in the amount of 1000 PEN. The funds will be used to buy more poultry and the appropriate feed. She will fatten the animals so that she can obtain a good price in order to repay her loan and, at the same time, improve her quality of life.

Jane is a hardworking and dedicated woman who always knows how to get ahead so that she can improve her life and obtain whatever she wants.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Merlinde

texts.en:
Merlinde is 52 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Merlinde has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 10 years. Merlinde has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.   In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: Augusto Cesar siempre ha sido una persona luchadora, pues siempre está disfrutando de proporcionar a su cliente los ingresos necesarios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, ha salido adelante por medio de duro trabajo y dedicación. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos y camisas para vestir. Es así  que podrá permitirle a sus clientes brindarles una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Augusto Cesar has always been a tenacious person.  He always enjoys supplying his customers and getting the income he needs.

His business is selling clothes.  He has had this business for over eight years.  He has gotten ahead through his hard work and dedication.

The loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses.  That way he will be able to offer his customers a great variety of products.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses.

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
Gloria Mercedes tiene 19 años, es soltera vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Gloria  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol y los comercializa. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos y los intermediarios que son con los que se hace el negocio. Su sueño es llegar a culminar los estudios universitarios.

Le gusta escuchar musica y colaborar con todas las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Gloria Mercedes, age 19, is single and lives with her parents.  She does not have children.  She lives in the Agua Clara precinct in the Chillanes Cantón.

The Virgen Del Huayco Communal Bank is comprised of 14 members.  It is located in the Loma de Guacalgoto precinct, 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members of the communal bank devote themselves to growing corn and beans.  Some of them sell either flour or animals.

Gloria grows and sells corn and beans.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo.  She sells at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

The loan will help her to buy supplies for her crops.  The loan has helped her in such a way that has increased her crop production.  She has faced challenges like insect infestation, plant diseases, and the intermediaries with whom she does business. 

Her dream is to finish her university studies.

She likes to listen to music and to participate in all of the precinct’s festivities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a hard-working 39-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children aged 14 and 8. Anna has been selling clothes for the last two years. She supplements her income from the profits she gets from her cafeteria. In the next five years, she wants to be a successful businesswoman who supplies boutiques.

Anna wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine for tailoring and to renovate her business premises. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learnt the art of saving and business management skills.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and renovate her business premises

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca tiene 57 años, Es soltera vive con la hija , en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo.

Le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca is 57 years old, single, and lives with her daughter in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) meet in the neighborhood of San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Maria is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her products at the AGRIPAC commercial center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. She plans to buy seeds and compost for her corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. Her dream is to buy a car to use for her work.

Maria enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
