Candida is 57 years old and a widow with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Candida runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Candida has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, eggs, milk, sugar, spices, etc. 

In the future, Candida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora  Teresa  de Jesús  tiene  treinta y ocho años de edad, se dedica  a la venta de  quesos desde hace siete años y a la venta de comida  desde hace tres  años.
Esta muy contenta  por tener su propio negocio  y ver el fruto de su esfuerzo  ya que le va muy bien y obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
Ella estudio hasta la  primaria terminada, tiene  dos hijos una mujer Karina de  doce años de edad   y un varón Gilberto de  quince años de edad  quienes le ayudan a  hacer los quesos.
Esta muy agradecida  con fundacion realidad  por el apoyo  que le  dio cuando mas lo necesitaba  y con su esfuerzo ya cuenta con un local donde realiza sus  quesos y los vende. 
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar los materiales que necesita para la elaboración de  quesos  como son: tinas, aros   y molino.
Es una persona  con muchos sueños para  sus  hijos como;   seguir ayudándoles para  que terminen sus estudios y tengan más oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is 38 years old. She has been selling cheese for seven years and selling food for three years. Teresa is very pleased to have her own business and seeing the fruit of her labor. She has done very well and has earned a good income.

Teresa finished her elementary school education. She has two children, a daughter named Karina (age 12) and a son named Gilberto (age 15), who help her with making cheese. Teresa is very grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support it has given to her when she needed it most. Through her efforts, she now has a shop where she can make and sell cheese. Teresa is requesting a loan to buy necessary supplies for making cheese such as vats, hoops, and a mill.

She is a person who has many dreams for her children, such as helping them finish their studies and providing more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy vats, hoops, and a mill for making cheese.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Gloria tiene 50 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia trabaja en el municipio en el área administrativo, ella es miembro del banco comunal desde hace 13 años y paralelamente a su desempeño en la municipalidad la socia tiene una tienda de venta de losetas, ella distribuye a sus diversos clientes al crédito, la socia tiene en Lima  a su hermana la cual le envía la mercadería, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de locería para implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lozas al por mayor.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" (Always United) communal bank, located in the Virgen Asunta market in the district of Huanchac, in the Province and Department of Cusco.   Gloria is 50, married and works in the city hall in administration.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 13 years, and alongside her duties in the city hall, she has a store selling tires.  She distributes to her various customers on credit.  She has a sister in Lima who sends her the merchandise. She wants  the loan to buy tiles at wholesale in order to sell them in her business.  

She is grateful for the support that she receives, and is committed to making her instalment payments on a regular basis.

loans.use: To buy tiles at wholesale

loans.name: Alafia Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALAFIA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Birina est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Birina est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Ibrahim. Le couple a deux enfants,tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Birina  et son mari.  Birina n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Birina mène comme activité la vente des céréales(riz, haricot etc.)et des colliers. Birina mène cette activité depuis quatre ans. Birina s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Birina sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALAFIA,un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Group Alafia is composed of three people who reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Birina, is the woman raising her hand in the picture.
Birina is 38 years old and is married to a man named Ibrahim. The couple has two children, who both attend school and are in their care. The various expenses of the household are taken care of by Birina and her husband.  Birina never went to school.
To support herself and her children, Birina is in the business of selling cereals (rice, beans, etc.) and necklaces colliers. Birina has been in this business for four years. She gets her supplies from Benin's largest market. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and profit, Birina is requesting a first loan together with the other members of group Alafia.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and necklaces.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
Ludith tiene 45 años, es socia D. Banco Comunal "Las Orquideas“ D. distrito de Tarapoto D. departamento de San Martín. Està casada y tiene tres hijos de 15, 20 y 28 años de edad. La mayor ya no vive en casa y estudia agronomìa.

Fue idea propia de empezar su negocio de confección de lencería y se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 10 años. El capital inicial fue de S/. 300.00. Desde entonces se estabilizó muy bien y dice que es muy conocida en su barrio. Durante todo el día su clientela le encuentra en su taller donde vende también sus prendas.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará telas, hilos y blondas al por mayor. 
Ludith tiene dos sueños, primero tener un negocio más grande y segundo dedicarse también a otros negocios para incrementar sus ingresos. 

Desde hace 8 años es socia de Manuela Ramos y lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los talleres que imparten los mismos que animan a las mujeres de ser independientes y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ludith is 45 years old and a member of “Las Orquideas” (The Orchids) Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto,  in San Martin department. She is married and has 3 children, aged 15, 20, and 28. The majority no longer live at home – they are studying agronomy.

It was Ludith's own idea to begin a lingerie-making business, and she has been dedicated to this activity for some 10 years now. Her initial capital investment was just 300 sols. Since then, the business has become well established and it seems that Ludith is well known in her barrio. All day long her clientele will find her in her workshop where she also sells her garments.

With this loan of 3,000 sols, Ludith will buy cloth, thread, and blond lace at wholesale. She has 2 dreams; the 1st is to have a larger business, and the 2nd is to begin other businesses in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy blond lace, cloth and thread for making lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 27-years-old and married to Richard. She has two children who are ages 10 and 8.

Damaris has a hawking business of selling cosmetic products. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy beauty products to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to add to her stock.

loans.name: Dorothy Apiyo

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, 2 and 6 years old. Dorothy describes herself as humble and God-fearing.

Dorothy has operated a clothing sales business for 3 years, selling to the local people. Her business is located in a densely populated area in Kisumu. Dorothy describes her biggest business challenge as insecurity. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to increase her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within 5 years. Dorothy hopes that, in the future, she will open another clothing sales business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Undarmaa

texts.en:
Undarmaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger, a mongolian yurt, in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband is a road specialist, her older two kids go to school and younger one goes to kindergarten. 

Undarmaa  started her garment retailing business recently by renting a counter in a local market. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy warmer clothes to retail.  She is a strong and diligent woman who says "Now that I have three kids to support I have to do my business more active."   She is requesting 1,670,000 MNT to buy garments from Erlian.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a 23-year-old married woman and has two children, neither of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Tereza requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rebecca has a shop that sells fish, such as mackerel and trout. She also makes and sells snacks, such as banana cue. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell and ingredients for making snacks.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell & ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Ramer

texts.en:
Ramer is married with 4 children. He is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Ramer provides transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month earns 8,000.00 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 25,000.00 PHP to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

Ramer has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ramer hopes to see his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Claribel Pastora

texts.es:
La Sra.  Claribel tiene su negocio de Farmacia en su casa de habitación desde hace doce años, ella es casada con tres hijos los cuales dependen de ella actualmente y están en edad escolar.
Ella trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las ocho de la mañana que abre la farmacia y la cierra has las ocho de la noche.
Claribel ha trabajado nueve préstamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para su negocio, ella visitas las instalaciones de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para hacerle algunas mejoras al local, como es la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cerámica, cemento, cielo raso y pago de mano de obra para el piso.
texts.en:
Claribel has had a pharmacy in her house for 12 years.  She is married and has 3 dependent children who are school-aged.  

She works every day from 8am, when she opens her pharmacy, until 8pm when she closes it.  

Claribel has taken 9 loans from Ceprodel, and these have been for her business.  She visited the offices of Ceprodel to request a new loan to make some improvements to her business premises.  To do this, she will buy construction materials such as: tile, cement and ceiling panels, and she will also pay for labor to put in a new floor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: tile, cement and ceiling panels, and to pay for labor to put in a new floor.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Advance Massage and Movement is not your typical massage business. Kim, who runs the Dallas business, said she and her partner, John, focus more on pain management. “We’re not candles and hot rocks,” she said. Together, they have almost 30 years of massage therapy experience, and in October, opened the business, which emphasizes massage, stretching and movement therapy. Kim requested a loan to purchase an alternate deep muscle stimulator machine, which is used by professional sports physical therapists, and a cold laser, which is often used by Olympic trainers and does not require patients to take supplements for recovery.

Kim recalled she felt a calling and great need for more massage and movement offices. She stated, “There are too many people taking too many prescriptions. We just want to help people help themselves, and to us, that’s huge.”

Without the loan, Kim said, the business would have still been successful, but it would have happened at a slower pace. The loan will also pay for free weights and equipment. To find out more about the business and Kim’s services, visit the website at http://www.advancedmassageandmovement.com.

loans.use: To pay for professional equipment.

loans.name: Umjima

texts.en: Umjima is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Umjima is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: La socia Ubaldina; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de animales, la socia  la socia sigue criando sus animale smenore y sus ganaditos, ella tambien vende los derivados de la leche como son yogurth, queso, mantequilla; la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de un ganado vacuno ternero.
texts.en:
The member Ubaldina continues in the business of buying and selling animals. The member is raising her small animals and her livestock. She also sells dairy products such as yogurt, cheese, and butter. 

The member is asking for a loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Purvee

texts.en:
Mr. Purvee is 50 years old and lives in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia, with his wife and two daughters. He has been engaged in the business of secondary raw materials for the last seven years. He leads his business between Ulaanbaatar and the southern province of Mongolia, Tsogttsetsy, as there are two large mining companies located there. Also he hauls meat and other raw materials from Tsogttsetsy to Ulaanbaatar. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to buy meat in large amount. So that he can continue to sell meat without inventory shortage. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy meat in large amount

loans.name: Ma. Santos

texts.es: El 27 de Febrero del 2014 doña Santos solicito un crédito para la compra de concentrado para engorde y vitaminas para sus cerdos los cuales vendió a muy buen precio cancelando su crédito el cual agradece a COMIXMUL y los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA. En la actualidad ella solicita su segundo crédito para poder comprar semilla certificada de maíz y poder sembrar en la parte de atrás de su casa de habitacion ya que dio la asistencia a la tierra limpiando la misma y preparando para sembrar. Del mismo crédito ella pretende comprar los insumos como abono 12-24-12, fertilizantes y entre otros que ayudaran a mejorar la siembra de la misma.

loans.use: Para compra de insumos agricolas y semilla de maiz certificada para poder sembrar.

loans.name: Elsa Lilia

texts.en:
Before she had her own business, Elsa was working in a business that made jewelry from stones and crystals. She began as an auxiliary to her boss in this business and learned this activity.

Elsa is married and has two children. She started to work because she needed to support her family's expenses. Unfortunately, two years ago her husband had legal troubles that sent him to prison (where he still is) and because of this Elsa had to support her family expenses by herself. After her husband left, she needed more income and quit her job to start her own business manufacturing and selling custom jewelry. She did this because she could increase her income this way.

Fortunately she has a good time with her business and now needs to invest in raw materials. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 650. She comments that with this loan she could increase the number and variety of products that will help her to increase her sales and her family income.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Anteriormente Elsa trabajaba en un negocio que se dedica a la elaboración de joyas de piedras y cristales, comenzó como ayudante, pues esta persona maneja grandes volúmenes, allí aprendió el oficio. Elsa esta casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad; comenzó a trabajar pues necesitaba apoyar con los gastos familiares, pero lamentablemente hace 2 años, su esposo se vio envuelto en un problema legal que lo mantiene en la cárcel; por lo que ella quedo a cargo de la manutención de sus hijos. Esto provoco que buscara independizarse y crear su propio negocio de elaboración de joyería de fantasía, pues así podría generar mayores ingresos. Afortunadamente le ha ido bien y a la fecha necesita hacer inversiones por lo que esta solicitando apoyo por la cantidad de US$ 650 que puede pagar a 6 meses, para comprar materia primar para elaborar sus joyas. Con el préstamo desea incrementar la variedad de sus productos y consecuentemente mejorar sus ventas y su ingreso familiar.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Miss T. is a very entrepreneurial person. She has one year of experience with her business selling office supplies, and she is very happy with that but she wants to grow her business and have more merchandise that will increase sales. She is applying for a loan of $1200.00, and she wants to pay it off in one year.

La Srita. T. is un apersona muy emprendedora ella tiene ya un año con su negocio una Papeleria,esta muy contenta por ello pero quiere crecer su negocio y comprar mas mercancia para que se incrementen las ventas por lo cual esta solicitando un prestamo de $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales quiere pagar en un plazo de un año.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a hard-working and responsible married father of six. He works for a business, however he felt the need to earn extra income to cover all the family expenses and pay for his children's education. So two years ago he started selling milk products and chorizo to his co-workers, neighbors and family, and the demand for his products increased and he gained many more customers.

To cover all of his customers' orders, Daniel is asking for a loan of $250 to buy the food supplies he needs to continue growing his business. He will repay it within three to six months. Daniel is making the effort to move his business and his family forward, but he needs your help to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Daniel es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Él trabaja en una empresa, sin embargo, sentía la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para poder solventar los compromisos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, y fue así como hace dos años inició con la venta de lácteos y chorizo entre sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y familiares, la demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado y ha ganado muchos clientes más.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, Daniel necesita de un crédito por $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Daniel esta dispuesto a esforzarse por sacar adelante su negocio y su familia, pero necesita de tu ayuda para poder hacerlo, en tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Buy milk products, chorizo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: "Life has become sweet and enjoyable since I became a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member  several years ago," says Mrs. Rita M.. Rita is 35 years of age with three children.  She hopes to improve her business turnover with the requested amount.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her inventory

loans.name: Migan Gérard

texts.fr:
Born in Notsè on December 20, 1980, Migan Gérard K. finished primary school before halting his studies to work as a miller. Today, as the owner of two mills, he is married and the father of two. A very energetic and honest man, he figured out how to manager his first loan, which he has repaid without a problem. He is again requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new mill. He believes he can increase his throughput and thus his income. He will then be able to do more to help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 20 décembre 1980 à Notsè, Monsieur K. Migan Gérard a cessé les études après le cours primaire et s’est lancé dans les activités de moulineur. Propriétaire de 2 moulins, il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Très dynamique et honnête, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit obtenu et l’a remboursé sans incident. De nouveau, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à l’achat de moulin neuf. Par ceci, il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi, contribuer d’avantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new mill

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
My name is Yesica C.. I sell cinnamon twists, cookies, candy, and newspapers in my small business. I have owned my shop, located in the Villa Nueva district of the capital city of Tegucigalpa, for five years. I need the loan in order to maintain my business and provide better service for my customers—the students and pedestrians who frequent the nearby bus stop. I am a single mother who has many expenses, such as paying for my children’s schooling. My profits allow me to pay for their tuition and fees.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yesica C., tengo este pequeño negocio de venta de churros, galletas, papel periodico y confites. Este negocio lo tengo hace 5 años en la coloni Villa Nueva de la capital de Tegucigalpa. El dinero lo ocupo para sustir el negocio y dar un mejor servio a mis clientes los cuales son los de las escuelas y peatones que pasan cerca de la parada de buses. Soy madre soltera y tengo gastos con mis hijos ya que ellos estan estudiando en el colegio, y de las ventas pago sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase of cinnamon twists, candy, cookies and other products

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese T., thirty six years of age, is a hard working woman who, like most people, has responsibilities.  Unfortunately, Ese’s husband is unemployed.  Together they have five kids who go to school at a nearby primary.  Ese’s main goal is for her plantation to thrive as well as her pork bun business, but in order for that to happen, she needs supplies as well as improvements.  Ese is applying for this loan so that she may purchase ingredients as well as proper cookware for her pork buns, and chemicals and fertilizers to gain maximum yield from her plantation.  In conclusion, she will have more profit with the same responsibilities and a much lighter financial burden.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation, ingredients for her pork buns business, and for school fees for her children

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: Rehana B. has been married to Saleem Maseeh for for 17 years and has five children: three sons and two daughters. They live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Saleem has a construction business, and all of her sons work too. Rehana used to work for a boutique, but cannot work anymore due to health problems. She contributes to her family's income by being the leader for her loan group. She will use her loan to purchase items for her husband's business. The other group members are:  Anees L. and Fozia R., who will also use their loans to help their husbands' construction businesses; Suriya L., who will use her loan to purchase a machine for her sewing business;  and Rasheeda B., who will use her loan for her cloth and material business.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
"I am Zakia F., wife of Muhammad Majeed. I am borrowing for the first time for our business. My husband has been working at a restaurant for little pay and now, he plans to start his own restaurant. I help my husband and stitch clothes at my home for my neighborhood clients. I am the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My daughter is in grade two and my son is still small.

My group members are: Asiah B. who requires a loan for her brother who sells objects made of clay; Rukhsana B. who stitches clothes for the women that reside in her neighborhood and now she wants to start a stitching training centre for these women; and Lala B. who needs a loan for her son who is a barber. I am the guarantor of these women and I am confident that they will repay your loan on time."

loans.use: Start up our own restaurant

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo Lopez is a gentleman, originally from the city of Leon and he has run a barbershop in the market La Terminal for 14 years now. He is married and has two small children who are school aged now. Alongside his wife, he fights for a better financial situation to give to his small nuclear family.

Currently, Mr. Pablo Lopez finds himself in a precarious position, because he needs to buy more tools for his barbershop like scissors, talcum powder, gels and combs, yet lacks sufficient funds. This is why he has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that would allow him to improve his small business which would directly help him to continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Pablo L. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León y que tiene su negocio de barbería en el mercado la Terminal desde hace 14 años. Es casado y con dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar y junto con su esposa lucha para mejorar la situación financiera de su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente la situación que atraviesa el señor Pablo L. es la necesidad de adquirir sus enseres de barbería como lo son tijeras, talco, gelatina, cepillo. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan mejorar la situación de su negocio y a la vez continuar manteniendo a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for his babershop

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria works every day buying and selling used car and motorbike parts. Early every morning, and with the help of her beloved husband, Maria leaves their modest home to visit the various cities in the Puno department of Peru in order to buy the spare parts. This allows her to make good income for the family, contributing to their well-being and peace of mind, and most importantly, providing for their two small children's education. Until recently, Maria was in very poor health, but thanks to the care, love and affection from her husband and children, she recuperated quickly. This brave and enterprising mother would like to increase her income in order to refurbish their home and provide a safer and more comfortable life for her loving family. Please consider helping this hardworking mother, who has always been very brave and optimistic.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La compra y venta de repuestos de automóviles y motos de segundo uso, es la actividad diaria de doña María; desde muy temprano y con ayuda de su querido esposo Víctor se dispone a abandonar su humilde morada para trasladarse a las distintas ciudades del departamento de Puno y así poder comprar sus repuestos y obtener buenos ingresos económicos para el bienestar y la tranquilidad de su familia y sobretodo para la educación de sus dos pequeños niños.Doña Maria hasta hace poco se encontraba muy delicada de salud, pero con el cuidado, cariño y amor de su esposo e hijos se recuperó rápidamente; el deseo que tiene esta valiente y emprendedora madre es generar mayores ingresos para refaccionar su domicilio y así vivir más segura y cómoda con su amorosa familia. Apoya a esta hacendosa madre con mucha valentía y optimismo.

loans.use: Additional funds used to purchase more spare car parts for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a member of the Las Americas Communal Bank, which is located in Jr. Emancipación Mz. G Lt. 30 in the Ucayali district. She is 48 years old and is the mother of one child. Her husband is a mechanic. With her first loan, Norma decided to invest in a small sowing shop.

Now, she continues with the production of children's clothing. Because her work is so detailed, she has many customers. In the mornings, she devotes herself to domestic labors; in the afternoons, she works on the production of her goods.

With this loan of S. 800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy cloth, threads, decorations, ribbons, elastics, buttons, et cetera. Norma is very happy because she never expected that her love for sowing would lead to the creation of a source of income and friendships, which give her much satisfaction.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Jr. Emancipación Mz. G Lt. 30, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es mecánico. Norma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad continua con la confección de sus prendas para niños (as), por el buen acabado y trazo de sus prendas goza de mucha clientela, en las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas, y en las tardes a las confección de sus prendas. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro telas, blondas, hilos, adornos, cintas, elásticos, botones, etc. Norma se encuentra muy feliz, no pensó que su gustó por la costura seria su fuente de ingreso y un negocio en el cual ha hecho muchas amistades y le da muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Muhammad Din

texts.en:
This is a 69-year-old man. His name is Muhammad D., son of S. D., and he lives in the Sorkhrood district of Ningarhar province.

Muhammad D. is a farmer and has 20 years work experience in this field. Now he wants to buy some stock and improve his work, but he doesn’t have enough money to do it. For this purpose he applied to AFSG to take a loan of 50,000 Afghanis.

loans.use: To buy some stocks

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
Uktam M. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has 4 children. Uktam rents a location where he runs a cafeteria and works as the chef. Uktam has been in this business for 5 years. He would like to remodel the premises and needs a 12 month loan to do this. This will allow him to attract new customers and to improve working conditions.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоев Уктам Житель района Рудаки. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Арендует помещение , которое использует под столовую. Работает поваром . Занимается этим бизнесом уже пять лет. Хочет отремонтировать помещение , для чего и запрашивает кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов улучшить условия работы.

loans.use: Remodel cafeteria

loans.name: A.

texts.id:
S., 36 year old, live together with his wife Sulastri and their daughters, Dewi and Diana at Patih Jelantik Street. They rent a room to live.

S. has been in the business of collecting garbage/ used goods for quite a while. He doesn't have any skill to do other jobs except for collecting goods.

He walks around Kuta area everyday and collects goods/ garbage. He usually collects goods made of plastic material, iron, used newspaper etc. Once a week he sells these collected stuffs to a collector depot. He can earn up to IDR 250 thousand per week (approximately of USD 31/ week).

He hopes he can get loan money to add his capital to buy more used goods so he can increase his earning.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Sudah lama S. menjalani usaha sebagai pemulung. Diusianya yang ke-36 saat ini, dia tidak memiliki keahlian lain selain mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan. Sehari-harinya dia berkeliling di sekitar Kuta mencari barang bekas menggunakan gerobak miliknya. Barang yang sudah dikumpulkan, nantinya akan dijual seminggu sekali kepada penadah yang akan menjualnya lagi ke Jawa. Adapun yang dikumpulkan seperti plastik, besi bekas, karon dan kertas Koran. Setiap jenis barang bekas harganya berbeda-beda, tetapi yang paling mahal adalah besi. Tetapi karena dia kesulitan untuk mencari, dia berharap bisa diberi pinjaman untuk dijadikan modal membeli barang bekas lalu nanti dia menjualnya lagi. Diharapkan pengahasilannya yang sekarang 250.000 per minggu bisa meningkat. Saat ini, bersama istrinya Sulastri dan kedua anaknya Dewi dan Diana, mereka tinggal di Jl.Patih jelantik dengan menyewa sebuah kamar.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Isabel, es de la ciudad de Yasy Kañy del Barrio Centro, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, con un hijo, y viven en su casa propia.

Tiene una peluquería y además un negocio de agro - veterinaria en su domicilio particular, con muy buena clientela formada. Ambos negocios generan excelentes ventas e ingresos para la familia.

Cristina es una persona muy sacrificada que empezó trabajando como empleada en una peluquería de su hermana, luego retiró un préstamo para montar su propia peluquería. En estos 3 años de funcionamiento, le ha ido muy bien en su labor. A pesar de su corta edad ella ya maneja dos negocios y dice que todo el sacrificio que hace es por su hijo. Para la atención de la agroveterinaria recibe ayuda de sus familiares mientras que ella atiende a sus clientes en la peluquería.

Ella desea el crédito para comprar más mercaderías para la venta en su agroveterinaria tales como pesticidas, veneno para hormigas y ratas, alimento para animales, antibióticos entre otros. Así ella logrará generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina Isabel, is from the downtown neighbourhood of the city of Yasy Kañy. She is a 25 year old single mother of one, who lives in her own home. She owns a small hairdressing business and a small agriculture/veterinary supply store in her own home. Both businesses have a good clientèle, generate excellent sales and income for the family. Cristina is someone willing to sacrifice herself for her endeavours. She begun working as an employee in the hairdressing business of her sister. She then got a loan to set up her own hairdressing business. In the 3 years it has been set up, she has done well thanks to her effort. Despite her young age, she is already managing two businesses and says that all of the sacrifice she does is for her son. To service the agriculture/veterinary supply store she receives help from relatives while she is serving her clients at the hairdressing business. She is looking for a loan to purchase more merchandise for the sale at the agriculture/veterinary supply store such as pesticides, ant and rat poison, animal foods, antibiotics and others. This way, she will be able to generate greater income and improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of veterinary and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Fabiola Berenice

texts.es:
Fabiola es madre soltera y una mujer muy emprendedora. Al tener la necesidad de tener un ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo deicidio buscar una actividad que le permitiera tener un ingreso, ya que si trabaja en alguna empresa estaría lejos de su hijo mucho tiempo, fue hace 2 años que empezó a elaborar y vender comida a sus vecinos y conocidos, y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para invertirlo en materia prima y así poder continuara con su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a single mother and a very entrepreneurial lady. Due to her necessity to have an income to be able to help her young son get ahead, she decided to find a way of living that allows her to have an income as working in a company would keep her away from her son for long intervals. Two years ago she started to prepare and sell food to her neighbors and friends, and little by little she has succeeded in moving ahead.

She needs a loan of $300, to be repaid in 4 months, to invest in raw materials and thus be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material to increase food production and sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 28, is married and lives about 124 miles from the capital of Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. Living in the Kampong Cham, she and her husband typically make US$3 each day. She says every day she and her husband walk their bicycle to purchase recycling items from house to house in the village and sell them to the recycling plant. This couple together has one child.

Chan K. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase recyling items in a large amount. For her future plans, she wants her child to complete at least high school and, if he needs to continue, she will strongly support him even though she knows that she will spend a lot, as she wants him to get a better job in the future. (Husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase recycling items in a large amount.

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Mrs. Socheata U. is a villager in Koh Ras Leu Village in Kandal Province. She is a teacher who earns a small income to support the family. 

Her husband, Mr. Hut Sothun, is a lottery seller. They have three children who are all attending the local school. 

Although Mrs. Socheata U. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot afford to build a new house, so Mrs. Socheata U. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house for her household. 

Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to build a new house for her household.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som S., 28, is married and lives with her husband and her three young children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows and raises pigs, making around US$4 each day, while her husband makes $5 a day as a construction worker who builds houses. The agriculture industry has really suffered in Cambodia over the past year, as the climate has had unfavorable conditions and inflation has been high. Som S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a mill to provide grinding services for an additional profit. With this purchase, the family believes that they can increase their income and raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Greetings from Jeanne d’Arc U. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jeanne d’Arc is 33 years old and the mother of 7 kids.

Jeanne d’Arc runs a hardware shop where she sells electrical materials, paint, building nails, iron sheets for roofing, locks, and cement. She employs 1 person to help with this business.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will be repaid over eight months. This loan will help her to expand her hardware business.

loans.use: Expansion of her hardware business

loans.name: Charm

texts.en: Mrs. Cham Chou is 50 years old and she now lives in the Ta Keb Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In cultivating vegetables, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow cassavas in the fields. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more cassavas to plant and grow. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Sao, is a fisherman. Mrs. Cham Chou has a child who is a laborer. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to plant and grow in the fields

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Life has been a constant struggle for Christina T.. At the age of 33, she helps raise her 6 children with her husband Roberto T.. With HSPFI assistance, she was granted a loan of PHP 8000 and she started doing business. Every morning, she wakes up early to purchase fish at the market for retail and display it in her small store. As of now, she is planning to fill her store with several lines of products like school and office supplies and several grocery items. Therefore, she is in need of capital amounting to Php 11,000 to make her plan come true. Christina is confident that with the expansion of her business she can be able to meet the needs of her family and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase school and office supplies & grocery items for sale

loans.name: Bibie

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Bibie H. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with two children between the ages of 4 and 10. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents cannot take care of him. Bibie has been selling an African traditional cloth called khanga since last month. She works at the business for five hours per day, eight days per week. Currently she earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. Bibie thanks you for her support!
	
Kiva partner SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth stock in bulk

loans.name: Bayasgalantogoldor

texts.en: Bayasgalantogoldor B. lives with his mother in Arhanghay province in one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His mother is 70 years old and retired. He runs a small carpentry business in his province. At the request of his clients, he makes wooden furniture, such as tables, chairs and beds. Although he is deaf, he is a talented carpenter. He has lived with his mother for over 20 years and receives a small state benefit provided to disabled citizens. Since the benefit money is not adequate for their needs, he started his small carpentry business. In the future, he hopes to have a stable carpentry business and be able to fully support his mother and himself with his business. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood and to replace his old table saw so he can cut wood more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase wood and to replace old table saw.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice M. is 44 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to one child, a son. She says her son is currently in the university. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to make enough income to take care of her son.

Alice runs a drinking spot. Her spot is located near the local market. She says she has attendants who serve the customers who come to buy. She wants a loan to procure all kinds of drinks such as malt, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Pepsi, etc. Alice has been in business for 25 years. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure more drinks

loans.name: Urantugs

texts.en:
Urantogs B. lives with her husband and two teenage children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are both high school students. Her husband is a cab driver in the city. Urantogs has a small retail business selling women's clothing. Once, sometimes twice, a month she travels to Ereen, a Chinese a border town, and purchases women's clothing for her business.

Urantogs rents a small stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells her imported clothing at the stall. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar's ger district, where most of the residents live in traditional felt-walled yurts which do not have running water. She hopes one day to be able to afford to live in an apartment with hot running water.

Urantogs says that she is working hard to make her dreams come true. She requests a loan to purchase more clothing from Ereen for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing from Ereen, China

loans.name: Joyce Nakimbugwe ‘S Group

texts.en: Joyce is a leader of a group with 4 members.  She is 31 and is married, with two children aged between 8 and 10 years; both of her children go to school. She resides and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with her family. Joyce doesn’t take care of additional family members There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi- urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Joyce sells smoked fish in the Kalerwe market, one of the Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 25 people a day and to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Joyce buys fish from the Gaba market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her shop. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Her main challenge is the rainy season  which stops her customers from coming to her. Joyce has been with MCDT for over five years and is using her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more fish and partly to pay school fees. Joyce aspires to see her business grow and to own her shop.

loans.use: To buy more fish and partly to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing crops

loans.name: Cetti

texts.en:
Cetti S. D. S. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Cetti has a small grocery shop next to her home where she sells snacks, dry goods, drinks and vegetables. Cetti also raises chickens for sale.

Cetti has been working with Manuela Ramos for eight years and was a founding member of her communal bank. She used her very first loan to purchase goods for her shop, which has since grown a lot. Cetti will use this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles to resupply her store. She makes a point to carefully search around for the best prices before investing in more goods.

Cetti has eight children, three of whom are still dependent upon her. She is raising these three, aged 14, 16 and 19, as a single parent. Cetti wants to continue to grow her business and is pleased to have a good location and customer base for her shop. She is happy with the help from Manuela Ramos and has been successful at paying back previous loans.

loans.use: Resupplying the store

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo sells herbs and drinks andnative medicine called "agbo" in Nigeria. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She is 34 years old and married with a child. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more herbs and drinks to sell. She says "thank you" and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more herbs drinks to sell

loans.name: Solialii

texts.en:
Solialii L. (0) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiusu. She is married and has five school-aged children.

Solialii owns and operates a handicraft business, selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 450 WST a month.

Solialii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,200 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

Solialii is now requesting a new loan of 2,950 WST which will again be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. The loan will be her 5th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Tawopaneh Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata G., Zainab F. and Aminata K.. They call their group Tawopaneh Traders, a Temne phrase meaning “let us join hands together traders”. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town 20 miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. Each of them is requesting a loan of LE 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, they can make better profits and improve their standards of living. 

Fatmata (left and attached below with her business) is the leader of this group. She is 43 years old. She was born in Rotufunk, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with seven children. Four of her children are adults, one is in class three, one in class four and the other is not of school going age. Fatmata sells sticks and firewood. She has been in this business for over ten years.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto E. reside en San Pedro Masahuat en el departamento de La paz. Juan tiene 69 años de edad, vive con su hijo Jaime de 32 años que trabaja como albañil. Para Juan ha sido muy difícil sostener a su familia ya que no cuenta con ninguna educación escolar pero esto no fue obstáculo para que Juan iniciara su negocio de ventas de billetes de lotería, que con un poco de suerte y mayores sean sus ventas de billetes, mayores ganancias obtiene, ahora Juan solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar más billetes de lotería para comercializar y poder lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto resides in San Pedro in the Department of Peace. Juan is 69 years old and he lives with his 32 year old son Jaime who works as a brick layer. For Juan it has been very difficult to support his family without any formal education but this was no obstacle for Juan to begin his business of selling lottery tickets. With a little luck and an increase in the sales of tickets, his earnings will increase. Now Juan requests this credit because he wants to buy more lottery tickets to commercialize and to achieve greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Evelyn is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells homemade accessories in the local community. Evelyn has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en: Halimatu A. is married and has four children. She has received senoir high school education.  Halimatu sells dried pepper and other food supplies. She goes to the market buys fresh pepper dries them and blends them into powder at Elmina near Ayensudo, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is a farmer.  Halimatu uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and upkeep of the family.  Halimatu will use the loan to buy more fresh pepper to process and and other food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Halimatu plans to save to further his chidrens education.

loans.use: Halimatu will use the loan to buy more fresh pepper to process and and other food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a strong woman and, at 54, she is still capable of farming. She is married to Romero and the eldest of her four children is 29 years old.

Natividad helps her husband till their rice farm. It is where they get their income for the needs of the family. She aims to give her family better living conditions so she applied a for loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is hopeful that this loan will be a big help in achieving her goal in life.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Mary Luz, vino a la institución por recomendación de un cliente antiguo,  es una persona muy joven, es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño de un año, el padre de su hijo le dejó el transporte (taxi), ella lo hace trabajar con un chofer quien le da renta diaria, tiene familiares que viven en los Yungas a aproximadamente 200 Kms de la ciudad de La Paz; no tiene deudas en otras instituciones, tiene referencias buenas de los vecinos como una persona muy trabajadora, por tal razon se le binda este trato preferencial y esperamos que trabaje de manera responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mary Luz came to the Institution upon the recommendation of a long-time client. This young woman is a single mother with a one year old child. The father of her child left her taxi, which she rents out to a driver on a daily basis. She has relatives who live in Los Yungas, which is approximately 200 km from the city of La Paz.

Mary Luz has no outstanding debts with other institutions. She presents good references from neighbors who consider her to be a hardworking woman. For this reason, she has been given preferential treatment with the expectation that she will work responsibly with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert her taxi into a natural gas powered vehicle

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning AWGUE est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi et a bénéficié de 13 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui servira à développer une activité de petit commerce; elle vend sur table divers produits tels que du tabac, du sucre, du thé, quelque effets de beauté etc. Elle participe environs à 50% à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Téning Wagué, aged 37, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of a village bank for six and a half years and received 13 loans which she managed well and repaid on schedule. This loan will help her to boost her convenience store. She sells on a table various products, such as tobacco products, sugar, tea and a few beauty products. She contributes to approximately half of the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

See Téning's previous Kiva loans here and here.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her convenience store

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
Evila es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 53 años, es madre de  tres hijos  mayores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es mecànico de motos.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de lencería y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò algunas prendas interiores.
Actualmente necesita 800.00 nuevos soles los que utilizarà en la compra de granos de cacao que posteriormente serán vendidos en el mercado de Bellavista de su localidad. 
La meta de Evila es tener una tienda de repuestos y lubricantes de autos y motocar.
texts.en:
Evila is a hardworking and active woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 53 years old, the mother of three adult children and counts on the support of her husband, who is an automobile mechanic.

She sells lingerie and has been a member of “Las Tigresas” (“The Tigresses”) Community Bank for four years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase undergarments. She is currently requesting a loan for 800 nuevos soles to purchase cacao seeds which she will later sell in Pucallpa's Bellavista market.

Evila's goal is to have a shop selling spare parts and oil for cars and scooters.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cacao seeds

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza A. is 27 years old. She has two children. Her eldest child is six years old and is studying in grade one next year.  She has a farm.  Her main crop is rice because people in their village are constantly buying rice for food. She wants her children to graduate from college so that when they are older, they will land a better job. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to grow her harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Guabira Ii Group

texts.es: El gruido “Gubira II” esta representado por la señora Maria Roxana y conformado por 15 miembros 12 mujeres y  3 son varones todos son conocidos del mismo barrio y muy trabajadores , cada uno tiene sus negocios D. venta D. diferentes productos como la venta D. comida y la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos,  y venta D. abarrotes  el señor William se dedica al transporte publico, José Luís a la  venta D. pollo a la Braster y el señor Humberto cuenta con su moto propia y presta servicio D. moto taxista y pertenece a un sindicato. La competencia no es mucho problema ya que no se encuentran al centro D. la ciudad si no mas bien en las periferias D. las mismas donD. ya tienen su propia clientela.  El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. insumos, herramientas D. trabajo y al mejoramiento D. las herramientas que ya poseen, algunos D. los socios invertirá en la infraestructura D. su negocio para ampliarlo y generar mejores ganancias que se traducirá en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. La mayoría D. las socias solo habían escuchado D. estos créditos en grupo, pero están muy satisfechos con el apoyo económico y la confianza depositada en ellos ya que muchos necesitan D. un apoyo para crecer y generar mejores ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Gubira II” Group is led by Sra. Maria Roxana and consists of 15 members, 12 women and 3 men. They all know one another because they are from the same neighborhood and are very hard workers. Each has businesses selling different products such as food, but the majority sells cosmetics and groceries. Sr. William provides public transportation. José Luís sells roasted chickens. Sr. Humberto has his own motorcycle, provides taxi services, and belongs to a union. Competition is not much of a problem because they are not in the central part of the city, but in the same neighborhoods where they have established their own clientele.

This loan will be used to buy supplies and tools, as well as pay for improvements to the equipment they already possess. Some members will invest in the infrastructure of their businesses in order to expand and generate better earnings, which translates to a better quality of life for their families. Most of the members have only heard about group loans, but they are happy to have the financial support and trust required to grow and earn more income to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 42 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Silvana has been selling scrap metal for two years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Silvana has requested a loan. 
Silvana is talented in her work because she does her best to suit her clients' demands and is very friendly. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues and didn’t have all the material needed for her sales. Silvana decided on going into this work because it was her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one teenage daughter. She owns a small retail business selling women's clothing. Her kiosk is located at a small market in Melitopol town. She makes about 4,000 hryvnia (UAH) per month. Svetlana started this business 10 years ago. She offers good quality products to her clients at affordable prices. Svetlana has many repeat clients that come back to purchase new clothing from her.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 13,000 UAH to increase her assortment, especially of her spring inventory. She hopes to increase her income and purchase kitchen appliances for her apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El M. is a local fish trader living in the capital of Phnom Penh. She has been engaged her own business at the market for years. Through her business she has the ability to provide enough food for her family. A widowed mother, she is bringing up two children while another two of her children are married and live separately. She has a daughter who is employed and provides little cash for the family. 

El M. always uses a very old motorbike to travel or supply the transportation for the business. Recently the motorbike broke down which she was using it for work and she hopes to exchange it. Because El M. doesn’t have enough money, she decided to ask for a loan of US$ 500 which will enable her to achieve her purpose.

loans.use: To exchange an old motorbike

loans.name: Ganawathi

texts.en:
Ganawathi is a 54-year-old married woman with two children who lives in the town of Dickwella in southern Sri Lanka. Her husband works in the masonry business and her two sons, who are in their twenties, have jobs of their own as well.

Ganawathi has a small food production business, making local treats and foods to be sold to markets nearby. She has been in the business for about a year now.

Ganawathi is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help purchase a new food-processing appliance.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy a new food-processing appliance

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Chepito, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace doce años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves, ella cría los animales en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los vende a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad es de suma importancia para la economía de su familia ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta ocupación no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia también hizo que empezara a ahorrar dinero para adquirir una mototaxi que actualmente alquila para brindar el servicio de transporte en la zona. Con este ingreso ella y su esposo pueden mantener a su familia.

La continua demanda por cerdos en la zona han hecho que ella esté pensando en ampliar su negocio, por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos medianos, alimento balaceado y en la mejora de los corrales en donde los cría, ya que no cuenta con el suficiente espacio para realizar esta acción.

Juana es una madre de familia bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior que les permita acceder a un futuro prometedor. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana is a 36 year old mother who lives with her husband and her two children in the hamlet of Chepito, a rural area in the district of Mórrope in the province of Lambayeque, located forty-five minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

She has dedicated herself for the last twelve years to raising and selling pigs and fowl. She breeds the animals in the back of her house and sells them to the dealers who visit the area where she lives. This activity is very important to their family income since her husband is a farmer and this occupation does not provide a consistent income.

The need to support their family has also caused them to start saving money to buy a motorcycle taxi which they currently lease to offer transportation services in the area. With this income she and her husband can support their family.

The continued demand for pigs in the region has gotten her thinking about expanding her business and to do this she has seen the necessity of asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles to buy pigs, balanced feed, and improve the pens they live in since currently their is not enough space.

Juana is a very hardworking and responsible mother to her family. Her biggest wish is to be able to offer her children the opportunity to study and have a promising future. She has worked before with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy young pigs, balanced feed, and improve the pens for her business raising pigs

loans.name: Bright Future Employees, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
There is a fascinating story behind hardworking K. Moses. This hardworking married father of two children began his retail shop dealing in general merchandise two years ago in Kihihi town.

Through acquiring loans from this micro-finance institute, he was able to start up his side business to help him generate more income for his family alongside his teaching profession. With this loan he will be able to purchase more goods and be able to improve his earnings as he looks forward to living a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Maria de edad de 56 años, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada, y la venta de fritanga  desde hace varios años logro vender, tiene la ayuda de sus dos hijas que aun estudian pero se apoyan entre si para lograr los objetivos ya que no tienen la ayuda de su compañero.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con poca ropa, con dinero proveniente de ahorro de lavado y planchado, lo que quiere comprar  paca de ropa y prendas de oro y lograr mejores ventas, la captación de clientes nuevos, mejores utilidades. Sus planes es poder ayudar  a sus hijas a que logren culminar sus estudios a si como promoverlas al negocio ya que ahora en día por la falta de desempleo hay que aprender a comercializar para poder lograr un equilibrio y no fracasar. Con este financiamiento es una puerta para lograr mejor invertir.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old and sells used clothing; several years ago she also began selling fried food. She has the help of her two daughters, although they are still in school. The three support each other in achieving their goals since María does not have the benefit of a partner. She opened the business with only a small amount of clothing to sell and with money saved from washing and ironing. She would like to buy bulk clothing and gold jewelry to improve sales, attract new customers, and increase profits. She wants to help her daughters finish their studies and learn to promote the business, since today there is high unemployment and it is necessary to learn to commercialize to stabilize a business and prevent it from failing. This financing is the door to successfully improving her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bulk clothing and gold jewelry to improve sales

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.es:
El grupo Michael está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas Agne Janett A. José, coordinadora del grupo quien desde 1990 vende y produce artesanías. Ella administra el establecimiento y las finanzas mientras su esposo trabaja en la producción de artesanías de madera. 
A. invertirá el crédito en materiales para el taller y en la compra de artesanías para el local con la meta de algún día exportar sus productos.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Rebeca V. G. quien tiene una pequeña venta y realiza artesanías en madera y Carmen Idalia C. H. quien tiene trabaja con video juegos desde hace aproximadamente un año.
texts.en:
The group "Michael" is made up of 3 enterprising and hardworking women. One of these is Agne Janett A. José, who has been the coordinator of the group since 1990, and who makes and sells handicrafts. She manages the establishment and finances, while her husband works in the production of wooden handicrafts. A. will invest the loan in materials for the workshop and in the purchase of handicrafts for the store, with the goal of some day exporting her products. Her fellow group members are Rebeca V. G., who has a small store and makes wooden handicrafts, and Carmen Idalia C. H., who has been working selling video games for approximately a year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make wooden and other handicrafts

loans.name: Henry Daniel

texts.es:
el sr. Henry Daniel Gonzales se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda en la cual vende ropa, sombreros, zapatos, y otras cosas mas. Henry a sabado administrar bien su tienda, le a dado muy buenos resultados, anteriormente tenia su negocio en su carrito y vendia ambulante, ahora ya tiene su propio local, el cual esta ubicado en la calle del comercio de este municipio. El sr. Henry se caracteriza por que da los precios mas bajos de la zona y por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir mas su negocio ya que entre mejor surtido esta son mayores las oportunidades de vender y asi sus clientes se sentiran satisfechos.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry Daniel G. has a store where he sells clothing, hats, shoes, and other things. Knowing how to run his store well has given Henry very good results. He used to run his business out of a mobile cart, but now he has his own store located on the commercial street of his town. Henry is known for having the lowest prices in the area and for his friendliness when serving his customers. He will use this loan to increase stock at his store, because having a better selection will increase his opportunities to make sales and to satisfy his customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, underwear, umbrellas, belts, hats, and shoes

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel A. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Lezel is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Lezel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lezel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lezel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lezel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lezel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Oliva is a 40-year-old, hardworking lady.  She is married and blessed with five children; triplets aged 10 and the other two 13 and eight months old.  She has been knitting sweaters for three years. Currently, she has one knitting machine and she hopes to acquire three machines in five years.  She has one employee and hopes to expand the business so as to employ more people in the future.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to buy knitting thread.

loans.use: To buy knitting thread

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra del Carmen tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es la venta de abarrotería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque anteriormente no tenía el capital suficiente para incrementar sus productos. Esta no es la primera experiencia con créditos pues la que ha obtenido ha sido satisfactoria. Incluso cuenta con clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su establecimiento. Por lo general recibe ayuda de sus hijos, pero normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia y su rutina diaria lo realiza desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:30 de la noche. Actualmente ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos que son lo más importante que sus clientes le solicitan ya que estos productos los ofrece de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Sandra del Carmen, 35, has been a grocer for over 5 years. Her beginning was very difficult because she didn’t used to have enough capital to increase her stock. This isn’t her first experience with financing; her past experience was satisfactory. She has regular customers that always come by her establishment. Her children sometimes help her but she normally works alone and is open for business daily from 6am until 6:30pm. She needs financing to buy basic grains which are the most important items her customers request since she offers these products in a favorable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Uuriintsolmon

texts.en:
Uuriintsolmon D. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, renting someone else's yard. His son, 3, attends a local kindergarten. His wife is an accountant at a Great Mongolia company branch which is located in Hovd province. 

Uuriintsolmon began operating various businesses, all related to automobiles such as a taxi service and car wash as well as tire repair in 2009. He has a good moral character and says " I myself, graduated from secondary school only and don't have any profession so I want to operate my own business to support my family." Uuriintsolmon is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Carmelisitacion

texts.en: Carmelisitacion A. is from the village of District II. She is 54 years old. Carmelisitacion is widowed and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Carmelisitacion provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Carmelisitacion has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Carmelisitacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelisitacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Carmelisitacion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the third loan taken out by Carmelisitacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
