loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Хурсандова Мухаббат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Дочь, работает в колхозе. Сама Мухаббат занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно - рогатый скот. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота для последующей перепродажи.
texts.en: Muhabbat K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is a 50-year old widow with four children. Her daughter works at a communal farm. Muhabbat raises  livestock. She fattens and resells cattle. She has extensive experience in this line of work. She is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle for eventual resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: La Proyeccion De San Jose Group

texts.es:
“L. PROYECCION D. SAN JOSE”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  11 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años.
Gladis Nora es una socia con una visión del emprendimiento muy positivo que gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con su familia, tiene 50 años, soltera, y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 3 son menores D. edad.
DesD. hace 4 años se dedica a L. venta D. mantas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado por L. zona, elL. se inicio con pocos materiales y justo su vecina le invito a participar en el grupo, y después con el préstamo completo para L. construcción D. su casita, con el esfuerzo D. su labor ha logrado comprar un moto taxi el cual le ayuda para generar mas ingresos, ya que elL. soL. solventa los gastos D. alimentación, servicios y educación D. sus pequeños hijos. 
El reciente préstamo será destinado para invertir en su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
The community bank called "L. Proyeccion D. San Jose" has 11 enthusiastic and entrepreneurial members who carry out various business activities such as: production, traD., and services. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 4 years.
Gladis Nora is a member with a very positive entrepreneurial vision that has helped her be successful for her family. She is 50 years old, single, and has 7 children, 3 of whom are minors.
For the last 4 years she has been selling blankets. Her business is located in the local area. She began with very few materials and her neighbor invited her to be part of the community bank. She had a loan to build her house then, through hard work, she was able to buy a motorcycle taxi, which helps her to earn more. She is solely responsible for the costs of feeding, caring for, and educating her little children. 
She will use this loan to invest in her business. All our members are grateful for the support offered to them and promise to make their repayments by the agreed deadlines.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia S. is from the town of Veruela. She is 65 years old. Laurencia is married and has eight grown-up children. She has been farming for quite a long time now. She plants and harvests rice crops, which she sells to the market. Laurencia still wants to be able to provide for her family and also her grandchildren. She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy always. 

Laurencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Laurencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida, age 40 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture), helps her husband support the family by offering embroidery services. She receives orders from neighboring areas and is able to help pay the family's utility bills with her business. She and her family live in Sahiwal, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. They reside in an area named Essa Nagri in a two-bedroom house.
 
Rashida's husband, Yunus M., is involved in a food-selling business. He makes Punjabi food dishes such as Nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread, pickle, and salad) and Daal chawal (made with rice and lentils). These two dishes are the specialty of his business and people from different areas of Sahiwal city come to him to buy his food. He has operated his business for 25 years and has established a good name in his area for the quality and taste of his food.
  
Rashida and her husband have a son and two daughters. They couldn’t educate any of their children due to poor financial conditions. Their son started work in his teens and works as a shoe polisher.

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy items such as lentils, cooking oil, and spices in bulk quantities that will enable him to prepare large amounts of food to sell to his customers. Rashida believes that an investment in her husband’s long-standing business will bring about positive changes in her family life. She also hopes to be able to collect some dowry money from her loan profits for her elder daughter’s marriage. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who has paid her installments on time and has attended very meeting.

loans.use: To buy items such as lentils, cooking oil, and spices in bulk quantities for food-selling business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa A. is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a candle-making business. She lives in Brgy. Ticad, Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her candle-making business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Marissa is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marissa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more raw materials to make candles

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa Aurora es una madre D. familia D. 56 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos en el sector Saltur, una zona rural del distrito D. Zaña, sus pobladores trabajan principalmente en actividades agrícolas, se encuentra ubicada a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio D. costura en un pequeño taller que tiene instalado en un ambiente D. su vivienda. Ella suele confeccionar prendas D. vestir a medida D. cada uno D. sus clientes, asimismo también arregla prendas D. vestir deterioradas. El negocio le ayuda a sentirse activa y le permite colaborar con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir material para cumplir con algunos pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho por temporada naviD.ña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora, 56, is a mother living with her husband and two children in the Saltur sector, a rural zone in Zaña district.  Its residents are mostly farmers and it’s located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small sewing workshop in her house where she supplies tailoring services.  She tends to make articles of clothing on order for each of her customers.  She also repairs damaged clothes.  The business helps her feel active and allows her to contribute to the support of her family.

Rosa wants to acquire supplies to fill some pending orders customers have placed for the Christmas season.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To acquire supplies to fill some pending orders she has from customers.

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eusebio Maximo; el tiene 59 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar donde vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y el se dedica a pintar casas es albañil, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer la chicha como maíz. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eusebio Maximo is a member of the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Eusebio Maximo is 59 years old, married and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business which is a bar where he sells 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  He also paints houses and is a construction worker.  He would like to expand and improve his 'chicha' sales business and is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making 'chicha' such as corn.

Eusebio Maximo is pleased to be receiving this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making 'chicha' (a corn-based drink) such as corn

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, age 24, is a single young man who lives in a place called Kirigu in Kikuyu town which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town. He sells phone accessories and has been operating this business for the last seven years. 
This is his second loan from KADET and he intends to use it to buy more phone accessories and expand his trade.  If the loan improves the business, he will open other outlets in Kikuyu town.

loans.use: Benson wants to buy more phones accessories.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 72 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su 3 hijos,  de los 6 que son en total. Después de haberse dedicado varios años a la atención en su tienda de productos comestibles, tuvo que cerrar el negocio; pues ya no le era rentable. Desde entonces empezó con la comercialización de artefactos electrodomésticos con la ayuda de su hijo mayor. Sin embargo la desalojaron y desde ahí trabaja de manera ambulatoria en una avenida céntrica de su distrito. Ahora le va muy bien y para obtener mayores ganancias, compra su mercadería en un mercado informal, pues les ofrecen a precios más accesibles, así es como gana mayores utilidades por cada artefacto. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio son las buenas ganancias que percibe, pero le incomodo la incomodidad de vender en la calle, por ello anhela comprarse su propio puesto en algún mercado. Es el 34avo crédito con MFP, como es socia antiguo de su grupo comunal, se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibe, así como también de las personas que hicieron posible en brindarle el préstamo, aporte que le permite continuar trabajando sin problemas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará ollas arroceras, ollas a presión, licuadoras y planchas, para bastecer los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 72 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three of her six children. After devoting several years to managing a grocery store, Rosa decided to close this business because it was no longer profitable. From that point she began selling household appliances with the help of her oldest son. After being evicted, she began selling as a street vendor along the central avenue of the district. Rosa is now doing very well and able to generate more income. She buys her merchandise at an informal market because the prices are more affordable, which allows her to make more profit on each item. What she enjoys most about her business is the good revenue she is able to generate, but selling on the street can be uncomfortable so she hopes to acquire her own post at a market.

This is her 34th loan with MFP since she is a longtime member of her Communal Bank. Rosa feels grateful for the all the support she has received and expresses her gratitude to everyone who made this loan possible, which allows her to continue working without problems. With the requested loan she will be able to buy rice cookers, pressure cookers, blenders, and irons so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase household appliances

loans.name: Deisi Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a Deisy, tiene 20 años de edad y  es madre soltera de  un niño de 3 años y seis meses, ella y su hijo viven en la casa de sus padres en la cual viven siete personas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y se desempeña como tesorera del mismo  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a personas como ella para obtener los créditos y sacar sus negocios adelante.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogos de las marcas Nivi y Gogos, por la calidad nos cuenta que ella prefiere vender de estas marcas ya que a sus clientes les gusta mucho sus productos, trabaja todos los días por horas, deja a crédito y cobra cada dia domingo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta a través de pedidos los mismos que entrega después de una semana, nos cuenta que lleva en este tipo de negocio por seis meses y que empezó con el crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de catalogo, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, entre otros. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the "Virgen De Monserrate" communal bank meets every 15 days. The city is known for its traditional culture and also for being located just a few minutes from the best beaches in the province, at San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Deisy. She is 20 years of age and is the single mother of a three-and-a-half year old boy. She and her son live in her parents' house: in total seven people live there. She has been part of the communal bank since it started, and acts as its treasurer. She likes it because it helps people like her to access credit and take their businesses forward.

Deisy sells clothes through catalogues, from brands called "Nivi" and "Gogos". She says that these are her preferred brands because of their quality, and her customers like the products very much. She works for hours every day, leaving credit and receiving payments every Sunday. The work involves selling door-to-door, going backk a week later to deliver the orders. She has been doing this type of work for six months, having started it with credit she received from this organisation [the field partner].

This loan is to buy clothes from the catalogue: trousers, t-shirts, and blouses among other things. Her dream is to own a clothing boutique.

loans.use: To buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses etc

loans.name: Nzole

texts.en:
Nzole is a married man with five children, three of whom attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Nzole has operated a business selling charcoal for the past five years, selling at retail and at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He also operates a retail shop which contributes to his other source of income. Nzole faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

Nzole is planning to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 59 years old, married, and has ten children. She prepares food at her home and then sells it at fairs in the Ayacucho area. She sells in the towns of Seccelambras on Saturdays, Alpachaca on Wednesdays, and Putacca on Thursdays. She prepares traditional local dishes such as Mondongo (a local soup), Puca Picante (a local dish of beets, potatoes and peanuts), adobo (a soup with meat and potatoes). She maintains her business so she can continue to educate her children. With her savings, she has been able to pay her medical bills.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Salud

texts.es: Salud P. A. y su esposo que como pareja se apoya mucho desde hace 3 años optaron por dedicarse a mercado sobre ruedas ya que de esta manera les va mejor que en una maquiladora. La señora Salud vende ropa usada en diferentes tallas, colores y su esposo tiene el negocio de tacos y tortas denominado “Los Tres Potrillos”, para que sus ventas se incrementen desean que se le apoye para comprar mayor mercancía y así sus dos negocios sean prosperados ya que de esta manera es como cubren sus gastos.
texts.en: As a couple, Salud P. A. and her husband are very supportive of each other.  Three years ago they decided to start selling goods at flea markets since this was preferable to working in a 'maquiladora' (cross-border assembly plant).  Salud sells used clothes in different sizes and colors and her husband has a taco and sandwich business called 'Los Tres Potrillos'.  In order to increase their sales, they would like to buy more merchandise so that their two businesses can prosper since this his how they cover their expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is married with two children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. He is 42 years old and has one child who is in school. He has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines and has been 25 years in this business.

Rolando requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in his food stall. In the future, he would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for his family.

*This picture of Rolando and his wife was taken during tabu (or market) day.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in his food stall

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol P., 50, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a cow producer and she raises pigs and chickens. Kol earns about 1.60 USD per day. Her husband is construction worker who earns about 3.30 USD daily. The couple has two children who work in a garment factory, earning about 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 180 USD on food, utilities, fees and other necessary expenses. 

Koh is requesting a loan of 750 USD to buy a motorcycle for her children to use to go to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Adolfo; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía, el socio vende mantas, collares, chompas y chalinas en la casa taller del distrito de Chinchero, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Mateo Pumacahua". It is located in the district of Chinchero, belonging to the province of Urubamba and to the department of Cusco.

His name is Adolfo. He is 24 years old and he is single. He alternates his daily activities with his crafts business. He sells wraps, necklaces, jackets, and sweaters from the shop in his house, located in the district of Chinchero. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. He wants to expand his crafts business. He requests a loan to purchase crafts in wholesale.

He is happy for the loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase crafts in wholesale.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 41 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Emelyn is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land where they grow rice and corn crops. Emelyn also raises pigs to sell. She plans to use her loan to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed. Emelyn works hard to improve her businesses and earnings.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 49 años, es casado vive con el esposo y con los hijos, tiene 3 hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, naranja y plantano. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener salud para trabajar y educar a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los hijos hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 49 years old.  He’s married living with his wife and children.  He has three children.  He lives in Agua Clara which is part of Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is their second loan request from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and also are merchants.

Miguel farms cocoa beans, corn, oranges and bananas.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and his sales at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

The loan will help him buy farming supplies for his crops.  The loan has helped him increase crop yields.  The challenges he’s faced are illnesses among the laborers and infestations and crop illnesses.  

His dream is to be healthy to work and educate his children.  In his spare time he likes going on excursions with his children and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Vicente Daniel

texts.es: El Joven Vicente,de 24 años de edad,habita en la ciudad de Leon,el es dueños de una barberia, el estudio ingles tambien trabaja como traductor.El empezo a los 16 años de edad,en la barberia de un amigo ubicada en su vecindario ,le sirvio de escuela por ahi aprendio todo lo que sabe barberia ,todo esa experiencia adquirida lo motivo a el a poner su propio negocio de barberia, esto lo hizo a los 21 años de edad con capital propio.  Hoy en dia lleva tres años con este negocio.Solicito el prestamo para hacerle mejoras de infraestructura y acondicionamiento a su local.Espera darle una mejor presentacion a su negocio,aumentar su clientela.En lo futuro desea tener varias barberias con trabajadores a su cargo en toda la ciudad de Leon. Sus proximas metas son estudiar una carrera universitaria y poner una barberia mas en el centro de la ciudad de Leon.
texts.en:
Vicente, 24, lives in the city of León.  He owns a barber shop.  He studied English and also works as a translator.  He started working at the age of 16 in a friend’s barber shop located in his neighborhood.  This acted as his school and he learned everything he knows about barbering there.  All this acquired experience motivated him to set up his own barber shop which he did at the age of 21 with capital of his own.  To date, he’s been in business three years.

He requested the loan to do some improvements to the infrastructure and to the furnishings of his shop.  He hopes to make it more attractive in order to increase his customer base.  In the future, he’d like to have several barber shops with employees under his supervision throughout the city of León.  His next goals are to study a university career and to establish another barber shop in downtown León.

loans.use: to improve his business' infrastructure.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin is a hardworking, independent livery cab driver and a father of one. He has lived in the United States for 38 years and used his first loan from ACCION USA to help purchase a used car for his business. Although he enjoys interacting with various clients in the city, he has felt the ramifications of rising gasoline prices. Benjamin works 7 days a week to compensate for these rising gasoline prices and tolls. He intends to keep his business afloat through hard work and car maintenance.


With this second loan from ACCION USA, Benjamin will be purchasing new tires, used chairs and fresh paint for his livery cab. He hopes to continue growing his business and interacting with clients.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a hardworking, independent livery cab driver and a father of one. He has lived in the United States for 38 years and used his first loan from ACCION USA to help purchase a used car for his business. Although he enjoys interacting with various clients in the city, he has felt the ramifications of rising gasoline prices. Benjamin works 7 days a week to compensate for these rising gasoline prices and tolls. He intends to keep his business afloat through hard work and car maintenance.


With this second loan from ACCION USA, Benjamin will be purchasing new tires, used chairs and fresh paint for his livery cab. He hopes to continue growing his business and interacting with clients.

loans.use: to purchase new tires, used chairs and fresh paint for his livery cab

loans.name: Umoja Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Zainabu,who is in her late 20s is married with three children; two of them are still at school. She has been selling cosmetics for three years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cement to make bricks, increased on cosmetics stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics and to buy madila (Muslim type of dresses), to sell next month during the muslim fasting period. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a land. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Umoja Kigogo" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and to buy madila (Muslim type of dresses).

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married and has 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 43 years old and her 2 children are in school.

Judith has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Judith has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is 47 years old and lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. She is married with no children. 

Ma. Elisa sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase a unit-construction motorcycle for transportation. 

Ma. Elisa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Ma. Elisa hopes to have more savings and income for her family's consumption and repayments for loans.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, es feriante se dedica a L. compra y venta cereales y animales menores, aparte D. eso tiene una chacra y siembra papa, para ellos solicita un préstamo y comprar mas semilL. y todos los insumos que se necesita para L. siembra.
Julia es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 15 años, se siente muy bien gracias a las capacitaciones, ha aprendido a invertir bien y hacer progresar su negocio, le encanta los ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Llapanchik”. She works as a trader who buys and sells grain and small animals. In addition to this business, she also has a farm where she grows potatoes. For this reason, Julia is requesting a loan so that she can buy more seeds and all the supplies that she needs for planting.

Julia has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years. She is very grateful for the training because she has learned how to invest well in her business in order to achieve progress. Julia also enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es:
María de 42 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

María se dedica a preparar y vender comida (pollo frito con papas) en su domicilio todos los fines de semana, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, pero a pensado en solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y realizar unas mejoras en su casa para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

María con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno se propone una meta se puede hacer realidad, con la finalidad de que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in her own home, which has only electricity (no running water).  It's located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district, which is part of the Piura department.  The area has agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

María works preparing and selling food (fried chicken with potatoes).  She does this from home every weekend, and has been doing it for several years.  She has her own customer base, but is thinking of requesting a loan of 1,500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy ingredients and make improvements to her home, so that she can continue providing her customers with good service.  With the income she will earn, she will be able to cover her loan and improve her family's living situation.

With her work and her desire to get ahead in life, María has earned the trust and respect of her neighbors, showing that when you have a goal, you can make it a reality.  Her end goal is for her children to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to continue preparing her food and to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Sheila already has two children ages 16 and 13 who attend school. To generate income, Sheila sells beauty products from a catalog to her customers in the village. Her spouse also works as a local farmer. 

She is now asking for a loan of P3,000 to buy cologne, lotion, powder and cosmetics to sell in the village. It would help increase her sales.

In the future, she would like to continue growing as an entrepreneur and enable her family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cologne, lotion, powder and cosmetics to sell in the village.

loans.name: Tugeme Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her late 30s is married with three children who go to school. She has been running several types of businesses. She has a grocery store, a beauty salon, sells second-hand clothing, and motor cycle spares.  She has been in these businesses for eight years now. She works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the beauty salon, second-hand clothes selling business, and the motor cycle spare sales. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the grocery store stock, salon equipment, second-hand clothing, and motor cycle spares.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tugeme" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store stock, purchase beauty salon equipment, second-hand clothing, and motor cycle spares.

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir is a small producer in the city of Bilasuvar in Azerbaijan. Together with his wife, he has been raising cattle for more than six years. This business produces the income which allows him to feed his family. In addition to caring for his livestock, he also sells milk and milk products and wheat, which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. 

Mazakhir has asked for this loan of 1000 AZN to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 36 years old and single. She has 4 children whom she adopted. Three of those children are in school. Rose owns a restaurant which she has run for the last 7 years. The business has helped her to care for the children and her parents. She would like a loan to buy more equipment and inventory for her restaurant. She hopes to use the profits to buy a permanent space for the restaurant instead of renting.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland owns a mini-supermarket and has dreams of starting an orchard a opening a larger supermarket in the future. He is the father of three children, and hopes to be able to educate his children and build a permanent residence for his family.  Roland plans to use this loan to buy yogurt and apples to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy yogurt and apples to sell in his store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28 years old and is a married woman with two children, aged 7 and 3. Lorna is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Lorna also raises pigs to fatten and sell. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feeds. Lorna hopes to achieve her goals, like saving for her children's education and building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feeds.

loans.name: Juakali Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Juakali Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Juakali group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose  takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Rose was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Juakali group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos es un persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado, es casado y con tres hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de el.
El ha trabajado veinte y cuatro prestamos, el acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 
A gradece a ceprodel por los prestamos brindados ya que ahora su negocio cuenta con mayor inventario.
texts.en:
Santos is an enterprising person who has his own clothing and shoe shop at the market.  He's married with three children, all of whom are dependent on him.  

Santos has had twenty-four loans and is turning once again to Ceprodel so he can buy merchandise for his shop.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans they've provided because now his business has more inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Alba Ruth

texts.es: La señora Alba Ruth a sus 43 años de edad es madre de dos hijos con los cuales vive en el municipio de Sonsón localizado al oriente de Antioquia. La señora Alba Ruth trabajó durante 25 años en dos almacenes diferentes uno de ellos de venta de ropa y el segundo de venta de adornos, es de esta experiencia que le surge la idea a la señora Alba Ruth de independizarse y montar su propio almacén de venta de adornos, el cual tiene desde hace tres meses. La señora Alba Ruth necesita de la compra de una vitrina y surtido para su almacén que le permitan mejorar sus ventas y así los ingresos para su familia. El sueño de la señora Alba Ruth es que su almacén de adornos sea el más grande del municipio.
texts.en:
Alba Ruth is 43 years old and the mother of two children with whom she lives in the city of Sonsón in the east of Antioquia.  Alba Ruth worked for 25 years at two different shops, one clothing sales and one decoration sales.  It was this that gave her the idea to set up her own decorations shop three months ago.

She needs to buy a display case and inventory for her shop so that she can increase her sales and family income.  Her dream is for her shop to become the largest in the city.

loans.use: to buy a display case and inventory.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur SEYDOU est né en 1974 à TIOKOROLA préfecture de SIKASSO. Père de 2 enfants il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses épouses à KADIOLO (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 8  ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, décide de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, il est a son premier prêt.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 3 tonnes et 1/2 de maïs. Il s’approvisionne à KAMBO et  environnants. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin. Il  les revend en gros au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Seydou was born in 1974 in Tiokorola, in the Sikasso region.  He lives in a traditional family with his wives and is the father of two children.  He lives in Kadiolo prefecture, within the third administrative district of Mali.  He has been in the grain business for over eight years.  His experience in this area has earned him a good reputation and he receives orders for grains, especially maize.  In order to have the necessary funds to satisfy his customers, he has decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and has requested his first loan with them.  This loan will allow him to buy three and a half tons of maize.  He buys his merchandise in and around Kambo.  He stores his grains in his shop.  He sells wholesale for cash to male customers and often carries his orders to Sikasso if necessary.  With this loan, he is expecting average monthly profits to reach 80,000 CFA francs.  The profits earned will allow him to repay the interests on his loan.  He will invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with two children. Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosalinda is a farmer. She's engaged in banana and root plant "gabi" (taro) production to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years and every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

Recently, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Naranjito Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Naranjito, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora  Francisca. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con once 11 integrantes, ellas son de la oficina de Curuguaty. Todas ellas demuestran responsabilidad  y la solidaridad las unas con las otras.
Perla es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser cerdos, y pollitos. Ella cuenta que su trabajo es muy duro, pues siempre debe de estar pendiente de sus animales y cuidarlos. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar y sostener a su familia día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para los animales que cría, de esa forma podrá tener un buen stock y no quedarse vacía.
texts.en:
The “Naranjito” committee formed thanks to Francisca’s initiative.  They are currently in the second cycle with 11 members.  They all are from the Curuguaty office.  All are responsible and mutually supportive.

Perla is a group member.  She raises animals like pigs and chicks.  She comments that her work is very hard because she must always be watchful of her animals and care for them.  Through this work she’s been able to help support her family day by day.

She’s asking for the loan to buy feed for the animals she raises so that she can have a good stock and not run out.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Karen Lissette

texts.es: Karen Lissette, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad, ella posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación así mismo cuenta con una panadería en la cual produce pan dulce y salado: como magdalenas, pan tipo baguete entre otros más. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Karen no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su familia, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Karen espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.

loans.use: Compra de harina, golosinas y azúca para comercializar

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a water vendor. She has been doing this business for two years now, and the business is doing great. She also owns rental houses and she collects rental income every month. She is married and blessed with six children. 

She wants to complete building her residential home with this loan. She knew Milango through friends and since she wanted to access credit to fund her business, she decided to join in. She hasn't faced any challenges of late, and the business is great. The extra income that she will raise from the business will improve her family’s food security and development. Her living standards will be upgraded by this business loan.

loans.use: To build her house.

loans.name: Progressive Union Group

texts.en: Lamin is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lamin was born in northern Sierra Leone twenty-five years ago. Lamin has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Lamin manages a telephone centre (mobile phone booth) where he make calls for people for a fee, recharges customers' mobile phone batteries for a fee and sells recharge cards.  With the help of this loan, Lamin and his group members will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Lamin will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to improve his telephone booth by buying mobile phones, recharge cards, mobile phone accessories, etc.

loans.use: to improve his telephone booth by buying mobile phones, recharge cards, mobile phone accessories, etc.

loans.name: Ntukano

texts.en:
Ntukano is 20 years old. She is not married and lives in Handeni district in Tanzania. 
She is a Camfed Learner Guide and she teaches students life skills in her nearby secondary school. Through this, she is a role model in her community and she upholds the spirit of volunteerism. 

Ntukano requests a Kiva loan to open a food store selling rice and beans. 

She plans to use the profit obtained from the loan to expand her business and to pay the school fees of her younger sister.

loans.use: to open a food store of rice and beans

loans.name: Sibada

texts.en:
To have an additional source of income, Leonida has been engaged in making soft brooms that they sells in the local community. She is 52 years old and has three adult-age children. 

She aspire to make this business profitable but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP8,000 to buy rattan and straw needed in making soft brooms that she sells in the local community. 

She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy rattan and straw needed in making soft brooms to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia, 46, grew up on a plantation and life on the land is what she understands and knows very well. She produces taro, bananas, and other fruits, which are sold at the Fugalei market once a week. Julia’s knowledge of farming and her understanding of seasonal planting and protecting crops from insects comes from her long experience working the land. She is requesting a capital loan of $875.00 so she can purchase organic materials to help insure a healthy yield and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, fungicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay L. and her husband (pictured here because she was busy farming when we visited) live in Phnom Penh with their newborn baby.  Lay L. is 22 years old and works part time in a garment factory, earning $2.60/day, and farming part-time on their small plot of land.  Her husband is a mototaxi driver and can earn $2.50/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a new motorbike for her husband, and to build a fence around their farmland to protect it from animals.  She hopes to have success in her farming business so that she can send her child to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and to build a fence around their farmland.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
"I urgently need to add another room to my home and install a floor because my family needs more space. My home is very small and only has 2 rooms: the living room, a bathroom and a kitchen. I am asking fo $1000 to build a room and lay a floor."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

“Me urge la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda y poner el piso ya que mi familia necesita más espacio, mi casa es muy pequeña y solo tiene 2 cuartos, la sala, un baño y la cocina”. Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto y poner el piso.

loans.use: To add a room and install linoleum.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en: Peka is a 22-year-old lady from the village of Vailele. She just joined SPBD last month and she is applying for her first loan $300 to start her BBQ business. Unlike many of her fellow villagers, Pkea does not need to come to the market for root crops or local produce because her family owns their own plantation. After receiving the loan, she will operate her business twice a week, on Wednesday and Saturday, which are the days that she knows she can make more money.

loans.use: To buy mutton flaps, turkey tails, potatoes, plastic plates, and other supplies for her BBQ business.

loans.name: Thi Chinh

texts.vi:
Ms Chính is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children. They live in Phú Mẫn hamlet, Bắc Ninh. Her husband raises pigs and cultivates their rice field. She makes bean curd (tofu) and sells it at the local market. This is her family main income, it provides a steady cashflow. The waste from the bean curd production is used to feed the pigs. She's requesting a loan which will be used to stock up her inventory of soya bean. Also she would get a better price if buying in bulk. She will be happy if she could get this loan, it would help her raise her family income. She will repay the loan according to the loan term

Translated frm Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chính 36 tuổi sống ở thôn Phú Mẫn, Bắc Ninh. Chị đã có gia đình và 2 con đang đi học. Chồng chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Gia đình chị kiếm sống chủ yếu bằng nghề làm đậu phụ sau đó đem bán ở chợ gần nhà. Làm đậu đem lại cho chị thu nhập thường xuyên và ngoài ra chị còn tận dụng được bã đậu để nuôi lợn. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm đỗ dự trữ dùng dần và mua nhiều chị sẽ được hưởng giá rẻ hơn. Chị rất vui nếu sớm được nhận khoản vốn vay này vì nó sẽ hỗ trợ phần nào để cải thiện thu nhập cho gia đình chị và chị sẵn sàng thực hiện các cam kết đối với nhà cho vay.

loans.use: Purchase soya beans to make bean curd

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Mr. Amin is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 41, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Amin owns a small flock of sheep and some cows. The business is going well but needs some improvement. Amin plans to increase the number of lambs he purchases to make his income higher. His family expenditures are increasing as his children grow. Amin has the application to receive a $500 loan approved by the Normicro Saatli branch. He hopes this credit will allow him to change his family life.

loans.use: To buy lambs

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs Minh is 54. She has 2 children who are married. She is a cadre for the Phù Lưu hamlet. The main income for her family is raising cattle. Her husband is in charge of the taking care of the cattle, her son & his wife are responsible for sales. The loan condition of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) suits them just fine. They will be able to pay back the loan easily.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Minh, 54 tuổi, có 2 con đã lớn, dựng vợ gả chồng. Chị là cán bộ phụ nữ của thôn Phù Lưu. Hoạt động của gia đình cô chủ yếu là chăn nuôi gia súc, chủ yếu là bò. Chồng cô là chủ cai xây dựng, vợ chồng con trai trưởng bán hàng. Vì vậy, với hình thức trả góp hàng tuần của Chương trình tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc, gia đình cô dễ dàng trả được nợ.

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Virginia Mercedes

texts.es:
Señora Virginia Mercedes M. J. belongs to the communal bank "Niño Manuelito". She is a member of an association of vendors of construction material (concrete mix and gravel). She takes these materials to the quarry to sell them, which is in the city of Huaraz in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 1,000 nuevos soles, she invested in the purchase of tools for her business.

With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will invest in her business to increase her income.

She is 39-years-old, and she works together with her husband to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Virginia Mercedes M. J., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito” ella es socia en la asociación de vendedores de materiales de construcción ( arena hormigón, ripio) extrae estos materiales para venderlos en la cantera, esto en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra para comprar de herramientas para su negocio.

Con este préstamo S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses lo invertirá en su negocio para poder mejorar sus ingresos .

Ella tiene 39m años, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: She will invest the loan in her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is a single parent, but this is not an obstacle for her, and she is an exceptional and virtuous mother. For a long time she has had a small shop, and with her hard work she has been able to contribute to the development of her 5 lovely kids. Now she is alone at home and would like to convert her shop into one of the best in the city, and she would like to refurbish her home to make it more comfortable. For this reason she is asking for a loan with the desire for you to be an important part of her project.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

CECILIA, es madre soltera pero esto no fue obstáculo para convertirse en una madre excepcional y llena de virtudes. Se desempeña desde hace mucho tiempo en su pequeña bodeguita y con su esforzada labor ha podido contribuir con el desarrollo de sus cinco queridos hijos. Ahora se encuentra sola en casa y desea convertir su bodeguita en una de las mejores de su ciudad y acondicionar su humilde casita para vivir más cómoda. A esa razón atiende su petición de un préstamo con el deseo de que usted sea parate importante de su proyecto.

loans.use: To increase capital to offer more products/Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Hồng, 50 years old, joined TYM fund in 2002. Her husband passed away long time ago. She has a son, he is 25 years old. She runs a woodshop fabricating wood furniture. She has built a good reputation, making furniture with quality. Her monthly income is 200 USD. This year the cost of living has increased so the price for wood has increased as well. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to stock up on wood for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hồng, 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Chồng mất đã lâu, gia đình chị chỉ còn 2 mẹ con. Hiện nay con trai chị 25 tuổi. Vốn vay của Quỹ được chị Hồng đầu tư mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế và các mặt hàng khác. Đồ gỗ do xưởng của chị làm rất có chất lượng nên có nhiều khách đến đặt hàng. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hồng khoảng 200USD. Năm nay, giá cả hàng hóa cũng như nguyên liệu đều tăng cao, chị Hồng muốn vay thêm 1200USD để mua được thêm nhiều gỗ đóng đồ.

loans.use: Buy wood to make table, chair …

loans.name: Nazareth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Nazareth M.. She is widowed, and has four children between the ages of 11 and 28. She has two dependents. In 2004, Nazareth established her crop wholesaling business. Nazareth requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mr. Uch T. raises pigs and makes wine from his house in Toul Chambak Village, Kampong Cham Province. He can earn on average $1.20 per day from these activities. T. also purchases piglets to raise and sell for profit twice per year.

T. is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase pig feed. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase rice to make wine. The loan allows him to expand his businesses and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase rice to make wine.

loans.name: Mejra

texts.en:
Mejra is a 55-year-old woman living in a small village near the town of Gracanica. She is a widow and has 2 grown children, ages 32 and 35, who have since left home. Mejra receives a small monthly pension, but otherwise needs to support herself by farming.

Mejra has a cow and sells milk and milk products. She wants to use this loan to buy some more food for her cow, to be sure that she has enough for the long winter. And given the high cost of food these days, Mejra believes this will be the best investment for her. She hopes she can buy some nutritious organic food so that her cow will produce high quality milk, and she can then sell this milk at a good price.

Mejra's future goal is to eventually buy another cow, but as of now she does not have enough money. She hopes to earn enough from these milk sales to help finance additions to her livestock for the future.

loans.use: To buy food for her cow

loans.name: Chela

texts.es:
Chela tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”de Huaraz, tiene un sueño, el de licitar con las municipalidades para ofrecer servicios de albañilería, por esta razón esta ahorrando para comprar una mezcladora de concreto y poder alquilarla, esto con la ayuda de su esposo.
Ella ayuda a su suegra a preparar helados y chupetes, quien distribuye por mayor a los diferentes colegios para su venta, con la ayuda de su esposo espera tener un negocio propio y no depender de su suegra, por el momento, vende en la puerta de un colegio, del distrito de Independencia de la ciudad de Huaraz, helados y Chupetes a muy bajo precio, la cual le genera un ingreso semanal de 100 soles, a la vez vela por sus dos hijos menores.

Con este préstamo de S/1 200 soles, que pagará en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar 2 sacos de azúcar, leche, bolsas para embolsar los chupetes y algunos materiales que ya se le han acabado.

loans.use: Compra de inusmos al por mayor.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Donatilda es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Donatilda vive en casa alquilada, Donatilda viaja cada 15 días a la feria de San Felipe que se ubica a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, donde vende maíz pelado, cereales procesados como harinas, y de la feria compra queso, carne, animales menores, luego de acopiar lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los beneficia en su casa y luego lo reparte de casa en casa y también restaurantes.

Donatilda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos y animales. Donatilda sueña con tener casa propia, hacer crecer su negocio y que todos sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Donatilda is an associate of the “Retoño Comunal Bank”. She’s 36, married with 3 children. She lives in a rented house. She travels 4 hours to the San Felipe fair every 15 days outside the city of Ayacucho. There she sells corn and processed grains like flour. She buys cheese, meat, and small animals, which she gathers together and brings to the city of Ayacucho, where she takes care of the animals in her home before selling them off to neighbors and local restaurants. Donatilda needs a loan of 1000 soles ($1US = 3 soles, approx) to invest in cheese and animals. Donatilda dreams of owning a house, growing a business and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Donatilda needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in cheese and animals.

loans.name: Sihaba

texts.en:
Sihaba is a 41 year old widow with one child. She has been selling fish in Zanzibar for two years. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $35 each month.

Sihaba is hoping that taking her first loan from BRAC Tanzania will allow her to buy more food to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Dear

texts.en:
Mrs. Dear U. lives in Pong Ro Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who has a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

Her husband, Mr. Son Kheourt, is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since his ducks now have a lot of ducklings, he does not have enough money to buy duck food to feed them. Thus, Mrs. Dear U. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. 

Mrs. Dear U. is 22 years old and the mother of a 4-year-old child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy duck food to feed his ducks.

loans.name: Ruth J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Ruth M. from Mbarali. Married with one child aged four, she is additionally responsible for supporting two dependents whose parents cannot take care of them. Ruth has been operating a soft drinks business and salon since 2002. 

Working at the business 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week, and currently earning about $406 a month, she is now requesting a loan of $625 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks and salon equipment. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Ruth thanks you for your support!

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world and it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing - a very cheap marketing tool! This explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania! 

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of soft drinks and salon equipment.

loans.name: Dzalilou

texts.fr: Mr B. Dzalilou est né en 1970 à Cotonou. Célibataire, il exerce le métier de mécanicien qui lui réussit bien. Afin d’agrandir son garage et acheter de nouveaux matériels de travail, il sollicite un financement. Son courage et son dynamisme lui permettront de mieux gérer son garage et de prendre convenablement en charge.
texts.en:
Mr Dzalilou B. was born in 1970 in Cotonou. Unmarried, he's a mechanic, and is doing well. He's seeking this loan in order to enlarge his garage and purchase new work equipments. His courage and energy will enable him to better run his garage, and to adequately support himself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his garage and purchase work equipments

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin has to shoulder a great deal of responsibility, which drives him to work hard to improve his life. He is farmer; specifically, he grows potatoes and maize. He hopes to improve his business in order to better provide for his family. For that reason, he wants to invest in his business, expand his crop fields, and improve the quality of his crops. Indeed, Muhidin knows that, by taking care of his land and working diligently, he will grow excellent crops which will be well-received in the marketplace. Now, Muhidin is seeking a loan so that he can purchase fertilizers for his land. Please support this hardworking man so that his efforts are worthwhile.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Joice, a clothes and food seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $25 working daily at her business from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more clothes and food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Joice is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Joice A. and Teresia, both of whom also have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food items for her business.

loans.name: Christo

texts.en: Christo O. sells ice cream and drinks. He is also a laundry man. Christo is 42 years old and married with four children. He has one laundry machine but he is not able to meet the demands of his customers. He needs a loan for N120000 to purchase another laundry machine to enable him meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one laundry machine

loans.name: Rona Fe

texts.en:
Rona Fe P. is a 23-year-old mother of two. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital for a variety store. She applied for this loan to buy assorted soft drinks, candies, bread, canned foods, and others to sustain her business. 

Rona Fe is glad to have this venture, for she earns income she saved for her weekly payment and it supports the needs of her family. She hopes to expand her store in the future in order to keep her regular customers. She dreams of saving more money to be able to send her children to school and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for variety store

loans.name: Cumplidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las cumplidas está compuesto por 13 socias y socios, mismos que se conocen muy bien entre ellos, la presidenta del banco es la sra. Nancy que se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años atrás, por otra parte el resto del grupo se dedica a: También a comercializar diferentes articulos, venden hamácas, cosméticos, cotillones y ropa. Los socios del grupo están concientes de la responsabilidad que asumen al contraer una deuda por lo que trabajan bien juntos.
texts.en:
Las Cumplidas community back has 13 members. They know each other very well. The president of the bank, Nancy, has over 10 years of business experience. The rest of the group sells different items like hammocks, cosmetics, decorations and clothes. The group members are aware of the responsibility that they assume with a loan, and they will work well together to meet that responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mohi

texts.ru: Файзиева Мохи женщина 47 лет, замужем имеет четверых детей.Она жительница Костакоза, там же она занимается продажей аптечных товаров.Мохи уже шестой год кредитуется в Микроинвест.Раньше её оборотный капитал составлял половину сегодняшнего,и всё это благодаря займам, которые были использованы на расширение бизнеса.Также у неё улучшилась семейная жизнь.Товар её уже привозит сама Российская фирма, т.к. уже Мохи вошла в доверие всех поставщиков.У Мохи всегда стабильная торговля, благодаря её отличному обслуживанию и качественному товару.Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для увеличения товара.
texts.en:
Mohi F. is a 47 year old woman; she is married and has four children. She is a resident of Kostakoz where she sells pharmaceuticals. This is Mohi’s sixth year borrowing from MicroInvest. Earlier, her working capital was half of what it is today and all of this is thanks to the loans that were used to grow her business. Also, her family’s life has improved. Her products are brought to her by a Russian firm, as Mohi is trusted by all her suppliers. Mohi always has stable sales thanks to her excellent customer service and quality products. She would like to use her next loan to increase her products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medical products for sale

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
There are two borrowers who have joined this small loan group, and Mr. Oeun B., 34, was selected to be leader by the other member. Oeun B. is a married man and the father of four children, who are single and attend school. Presently, he is a domestic statue carver, who is earning an average of US$ 7 a day to cover his family’s daily expenses. The other income source comes from his wife who sells a few groceries from home.

Oeun B. is running his business smoothly and a lot of customers recognize the good quality and beauty of the statues he makes. In order to make the business more successful, Oeun B. requested a loan to purchase a piece of wood to make a more statues to sell. The other borrower is Mrs. Chan T., age 49, a vegetable seller, who is applying for a loan for capital to grow her business. The two borrowers (pictured) are village people living in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of wood for carving

loans.name: Revina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Revina D. from Mwanza. She is single. Revina has been running a beauty salon since 2006. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Revina currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair and blue hair. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Revina thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair pieces for beauty salon.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es: Julieth tiene 20 años, es una joven muy trabajadora que vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la apoyaron para salir adelante. Aunque aún es muy joven siente que tiene la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, actualmente el negocio al que se dedica es el servicio de cabinas de internet, el cual pudo instalar gracias a la ayuda de sus padres. Estas cabinas las atiende ella misma y se encarga de administrarla, además su negocio tiene muy buena ubicación, ya que no hay muchos por la zona en la que vive. Lo que más le gusta a Julieth de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, pero le es muy difícil atender ella sola a todos las personas que concurren a sus cabinas de Internet. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro pueda incrementar la cantidad de computadoras que tiene, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Julieth con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se llegan en las reuniones de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar una de sus computadoras, ya que por el uso continuo sufrió unos desperfectos. Con el resto del dinero comprará más sillas de plástico para su negocio.
texts.en:
Julieth, 20, is a very hard working young woman. She lives with her parents; they have always helped her to get ahead. Even though she is very young, she feels that she has the responsibility to help her parents with the household expenses. She now has an Internet café, which she was able to install thanks to her parents’ help. She runs and administers the business herself. Her business is in a very good location because there are not many like it in her zone. What Julieth likes best about her work is taking care of her customers. The hardest part is that she must, by herself, take care of everyone who comes to her Internet cafe. She has been doing this for two years. In the future she hopes to be able to increase the number of computers that she has. She knows that she has to work hard to reach her goals. She is prepared to do so. This is Julieth’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to be able to make her payments on time, the same as she did with her previous loans. She is very happy in her Community Bank. She is always up to date with the agreements made in the group meetings. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to fix one of her computers. Continual usage has caused some problems. With the rest of the money she will buy plastic chairs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer repair

loans.name: Kucherboi

texts.ru: Махмалиев Кучербой проживает в районе Хуросона. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Кучербой более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Ему в этом также помогают дети. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Kucherboi M. lives in the Hurosona district. He is 42 years old, married and has five children. For more than eight years, Kucherboi has been engaged in raising livestock. He raises and sells cattle at the market. In this way, he helps his children. He is requesting a loan in order to buy bighorn cattle.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bighorn cattle

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni S. (0) is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Manono Tai. She is married and has four infant children. Iuni owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. In 2009, Iuni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
