Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando y  ha los cuales les quiere dar la educación necesaria para su futuro.
Ya empezó el ciclo escolar y no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar el inscripción y comprar les los útiles y uniformes escolares. Es pos eso que está solicitando un préstamo para que sus hijos puedan en pesar el ciclo escolar sin ningún problema.
El es empleado de una fábrica en el departamento de planeador de materiales, este el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual planean pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos is a family man with two school-aged children. He wants to provide them with the education they need for their future.

The school year has already started and he does not have the money to pay for the registration fees, school supplies, and uniforms. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that his children can attend school without any problems.

Sr. Juan Carlos is employed at a factory where he works in the materials planning department. His income enables him to support his family and will use part of it to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for registration fees, school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Larchi

texts.en: Larchi is forty – seven years old. He is married and a father of two children, both in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. It is a commercial and farming town. Larchi is a trader. He trades in food stuffs such as plantain, yam, etc. He supplies to retailers and chop bar operators in his community. He has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
30-year-old Josie F. is managing a rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato. She’s married and has a 4-year old child. Her husband inherited 1 and 1/4 hectare rice field with 86 to 100 sacks per harvest.  Her husband also owns a T-shirt printing and print shop as another source of income. 

She needs an additional capital to purchase farm supplies and pay for using hand tractor in their farm business.  She’s requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for Php 6,000.  CEVI offers the lowest interest rate and the loan would be of great help in financing her existing business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Huk Sunqulla Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Huk SunqulL., se encuentra ubicado en L. comunidad D. Paucara, distrito del mismo nombre, provincia D. Acobamba, departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad se dedica principalmente a L. ganadería y a L. agricultura.

Una D. sus socias es Alejandra, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Alejandra se dedica a al venta D. prendas D. vestir, las cuales compra en L. ciudad y las venD. en su comunidad. Alejandra requiere D. un préstamo, el cual invertirá en su negocio adquiriendo mas prendas D. vestir. Alejandra trabaja arduamente para mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia, lo cual para elL. es una meta.

Luz es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Luz tiene por negocio una ferretería, en donD. venD. materiales D. construcción, los cuales adquiere en L. ciudad y venD. en su comunidad. Luz, requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual abastecerá su ferretería. Luz, quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida, así como L. D. su familia, para lo cual ya se encuentra ahorrando.
texts.en:
The “Huk SunqulL.” Communal Bank is located in the community of Paucara, Paucara District, Acobamba Province, Department of Huancavelica. The main business activities in this area are livestock breeding and agriculture.

One of the members is Alejandra, who is married and has one child. She purchases clothing in the city and sell the merchandise she acquires in her community. Alejandra is in need of loan so that she can invest in her business and acquire additional inventory. She works extremely hard in order to improve the quality of life for her family, which is one of her goals.

Luz is in a common law marriage and has 3 children. She operates a hardware business in which she sells construction materials. Luz acquires her inventory in the city and then sells the products in her community. She needs a loan to purchase more hardware. Luz hopes to improve the living conditions for herself and her family, which is the reason why she started saving.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for their respective businesses

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is happy to be a farmer, not just because his farm provides food for his family, but also because he can sell to and be of service to others needing rice. He is 30 years old, married, and has three young children. His oldest is only seven years old and is enrolled in a school in their town. 

According to Leo, his farm still lacks funding. He applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of 12,000 PHP. Leo will use this loan to fund his farm and hopefully be able to expand his business and market.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Elda

texts.es: La señora Elda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabón, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Lleva 01 año, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. También, Elda cuenta con un fundo, ubicada a 02 kilómetros de la Ciudad, donde cría sus animales, como chanchos, gallinas y cuenta también con una piscigranja, donde cría sus peces. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos y vitaminas, para sus animales. Elda, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Elda is a member of the “Los Diamantes” community bank in the district of Eslabón, province of Bellavista, department of San Martín. She is married, 55-years-old, and the mother of two grown children. For one year, she has been providing urban transportation services in her motorcar. In order to do this work, her husband takes care of moving about the different places in the city. Her start came with her first Manuela Ramos loan, and little by little she was able to begin saving, and this money went to buy spare parts in order to better serve the inhabitants in her community. Also, Elda has a farm located 2 kilometers outside the city, where she raises her animals, among them pigs and chickens. It also contains a fish farm, where she raises her fish. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles ($1050), she plans to buy parts and oils, such as lubricants, and spark plugs in order to provide much better service and care to her customers. Part of the money will also be invested in buying feed and vitamins for her animals. Elda states that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights and make it so they are all respected. She is grateful that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos has helped her begin her faming venture.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts to improve her transportation service

loans.name: Maria  Laura

texts.es: La Señorita Maria Laura T. Es originaria de la comunidad del paraje Chiyax un lugar muy visitado por persona nacionales e internacionales por su ubicacion geografica la vista panoramica de la ciudad procer de Totonicapan  de sus edificios  de su iglesia, ella manifiesta que su actividad lo aprendio de su querida madrecita cuando tenia trece años hasta la fecha sigue con este artes de la confeccion de delantales y cortes para damas necesita de un capital por las fietas de navidad y año nuevo para surtir su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Maria Laura T. lives in Chiyax, a very popular place that, because of its location, receives many visitors, both international and national, who come to enjoy its panoramic view of the great city of Totonicapan, its buildings, its church. She tells us that she learned her craft at the age of thirteen from her dear mother and continues with it to this day. She makes aprons and women's clothes. She needs financing to stock up on merchandise for the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La señora CORNELIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de seis hijos, tres aun están bajo su poder. Rildo tiene 22 años y Juan cesar estudian la carrera profesional de Turismo y Richi tiene 25 años y estudia para chef.
 
Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de pollipapas (comida peruana que consta de papas y un trozo de pollo) con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio que empezó con 200 nuevos soles de ganancia hasta la fecha ha ido ganando 400 nuevos soles diarios. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a consumir a su polleria que personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para abrir una brosteria pues en esta época del año es cuando más se vende comida como pollo broster.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Señora Cornelia is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Luz del Mañana," which is part of the Arariwa Association located in Cusco province, in the provincial department of Cusco. She is married, 56 years old, and is the mother of 6 children, 3 of whom are still in her care. Rildo (22), and Juan Cesar are studying to earn professional degrees in tourism, and Richi (25) is studying to become a chef. Her character and her desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling pollipapas (a Peruvian meal consisting of potatoes and a piece of chicken), the proceeds of which would contribute to the family's income. At the start her earnings were 200 nuevos soles, but currently she has been earning 400 nuevos soles per day. She now has regular customers who turn up daily to consume her chicken meals, and she personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma. She has already had this business for some years now and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who strives to advance her family in spite of adversity. She needs a loan to open a brosteria (a fast food business offering fried chicken and other dishes), as this is the time of year when food such as fried chicken is high in demand. Cornelia is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and as such promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a brosteria (fast food business offering roasted chicken and other dishes)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
K. Halima is 26-year old woman, married with two children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Halima. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of livestock. She started this business 5 years ago with the support of her husband. Now that Halima has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity. She would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Halima is requesting a loan of $1500 US Dollars. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dream a reality.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle for breeding and selling

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, es una mujer muy honesta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 34 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de plátano al por mayor, pero también se dedica a la venta de granos (maíz y arroz) a los almacenes de la zona, ambas actividades la realiza en el puerto de la ciudad de Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al oficio de operador de maquinas pesadas. Victoria forma parte del Banco comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la venta de granos de maíz, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles que será invertido en la compra de granos y plátanos al por mayor. La meta de Victoria es tener una tienda de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Victoria is an honest woman who lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali Region. She is 34 years old and the mother of three dependent children. Victoria buys and sell plantains wholesale, but she also sells grain (corn and rice) to stores in the area. She manages both businesses in the port city of Pucallpa. Her husband works as a heavy equipment operator and provides additional support.

Victoria joined the Communal Bank “Manos Maravillosas” (Wonderful Hands) eight years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 800 soles and was used to buy corn. At the moment, she needs a loan of 800 soles in order to buy grain and plantains in bulk. Victoria’s goal is to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plantains & grain in bulk

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa G. est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. Son crédit lui permet de développer son activité de vente de fruits de saison tel que des oranges et des mandarines.  Cette activité lui génère des bénéfices lui permettant de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa G. is 49 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank for the past three and a half years. Her loan will allow her to build up her business selling seasonal fruits such as oranges and mandarins. This business generates profits which allow her to contribute to the various household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her income-generating activity

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Bose is 35 years old and married with three children. Her eldest child is 14 years old. Her children are still young and they depend on her. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the home. 

Bose is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Her children are still young, and they are dependent on her. Her husband is a mechanic, and he also supports their home. She sells motor spare parts to make a living. She has been in this business for 11 years, and she is itching for expansion in her business. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. She needs a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus has a farm with mixed crops near Murang'a in the Central Province of Kenya. He is 32 years old and has already been farming for eleven years. He grows cash crops, like tea and coffee, and horticultural crops. He is also a dairy farmer and sells his milk through the local Kenya Cooperative Creamery. The challenges to his business are lack of funding, the expensive price of animal feeds, and a poor market for milk.
Cyrus has successfully repaid a previous loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 60,250 KES and is requesting a new loan for 47,700 KES to buy and insure an additional dairy cow. He hopes that with this loan he can improve his income enough to move from his parents' house and build his own home for his young family. In the future, he plans to have as many as five cows and produce more than 50 liters of milk.
He says that Juhudi Kilimo has improved his life with its financial help and good credit terms. He feels that his dreams can be realized only through Juhudi Kilimo's credit facilities so he is "here to stay".

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca Palo grande sector Santa Paula, la señora Melida M. M. ha dedicado parte de su tiempo para el desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias como es la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino y aviar, también se destacan los cultivos como el Maíz, ajonjolí y frijol blanco, dichas actividades van acompañadas con el desarrollo de un pequeño negocio de abarrotería por ser uno de las comarcas mas lejanas del municipio, lo cual le beneficia esta actividad comercial, con la cual se ayuda a financiar las actividades agropecuarias, las que le dirigen su hijo e hija respectivamente, con el crédito solicitado pretende mejorar su pulpería y comprar insumos para el ciclo agrícola de primera, la señora Melida M. M. ha tenido cinco créditos con los que ha logrado comprar 10 vacas paridas las que le aseguran gran parte de sus ingresos actualmente
texts.en:
In the Municipality of Somotillo, the town of Palo Grande, in the Santa Paula sector, Melida M. M. has worked part-time in farming activities, such as raising cattle, pigs, and domestic fowl. She also farms corn, sesame, and white beans. Her agricultural activities are accompanied by running a small grocery store. Since this is one of the most distant towns in the municipality, she has benefited by having this business. Earnings from the grocery store business finance her farming activities, which are managed by her son and daughter. With the requested loan, she intends to improve her grocery store and buy inputs for the first planting of the agricultural season. Melida M. M. has had five loans, with which she has managed to buy 10 cows that had recently given birth. These cows provide her with a significant portion of her current income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise and inputs for the first planting of the agricultural season

loans.name: Kanungu Development Club Group

texts.en:
She has a big dream of owning a big farm in her home area of Kihihi. On the face of it now, N. Agnes is in far cry narrow circumstances that may make her seem like a wishful thinker. This means she faces long odds in achieving her dream. She however has, at length, built a strong attribute of determination that has played into her hands.

With strong customer care skills up her sleeve, Agnes has gotten for her garments-selling business a dependable niche. It is one she has banked on for the last three years. Her family of three children has also enjoyed the good graces that have come with her doing this business.

Monthly profits to the tune of 300,000 are what Agnes has been getting since she began. With this loan she hopes to purchase more clothes and also expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. HIPOLITA,  ella tiene  52 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor, Nuestra socia alterna sus labores del hogar con la agricultura y el comercio minorista, Nuestra socia vende verduras al por menor en el mercado central de Iscuchaka en Anta, la socia también tiene ganados y trabaja de forma disciplinada repartiendo su tiempo en todos estos negocios, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
HIPOLITA, 52, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. She is a single mother of one minor son. She alternates her domestic chores with farming and retail. She sells vegetables at retail in Iscuchaka’s central market in Anta but also raises cattle; she is very disciplined about dividing her time between both these businesses. She needs funds to buy vegetables at wholesale. She is grateful for and values the support offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D., a 66-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fishing/fish vending and oyster culture business, lives in Brgy Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her husband and their four adult children. A member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002, Gloria has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Gloria is requesting Php 18,000, her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, so that she can continue her fishing/fish vending and oyster culture business. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for business

loans.name: Sandra Virginia

texts.es:
Sandra R. es una mujer muy activa empresarialmente, se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos y también ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras. Antes de tener negocio trabajó  como empleada doméstica, pero siempre soñó con ser independiente y poder dedicarle mas tiempo a sus hijos,; así fue que con su liquidación montó dos negocios, pues  además de comprar una maquina lavadora para alquilarla , empezó a hacer almuerzos y venderlos entre los vecinos y   ahora Tiene 3 lavadoras, vende almuerzos en el sector donde vive y también atiende domicilios en empresas y construcciones  en el norte de la ciudad, algunas de las cuales les pagan semanalmente.

Ha recibido dos prestamos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que le han permitido aumentar su capital de trabajo y desde que montó  su negocio, tiene mas tiempo para su familia especialmente para su hijo  menor,  pues cuando trabajaba como doméstica tuvo que acudir a familiares para que la ayudaran en la crianza de los dos mayores, porque solo venia los fines de semana a su casa.

Con su nuevo crédito por valor de $ $1.500.000 COP, va a   comprar insumos al por mayor  y otra maquina, también  va a  montar un nuevo negocio en un colegio cerca del lugar de residencia: va a atender su cafetería.  Su sueño es direccionarse en una sola actividad, que sea lo suficientemente rentable y le genere estabilidad para poder terminar de educar a sus hijos. Su nuevo desafío es lograr sostenerse en el colegio donde va a atender la cafetería y tiene esa gran ilusión de salir adelante siempre con su nuevo proyecto..
texts.en:
Sandra R. is an active business woman who makes lunches for a living. She also rents washing machines. Before having her own business, she worked as domestic help, but always dreamed of being independent and being able to spend more time with her children. She started both businesses with her severance pay. So in addition to purchasing a washing machine to rent out, she began to make lunches and sell them to her neighbors. She now has three washing machines, sells lunches in her neighborhood, and also takes care of houses and businesses in the northern part of the city. Some of them pay her weekly. She has received two loans from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo that have allowed her to increase her working capital. Since she started her business, she has more time for her family, particularly for her youngest son. When she worked as a maid she had to ask relatives for help raising her two oldest kids because she only came home on weekends. With her new loan of $1.500.000 COP, she will buy supplies at wholesale and another machine. She is also going to start another business in a high school near her home -- she is going to take care of the cafeteria. Her dream is to only have one business that is profitable enough, and provides enough stability, to to be able to finish educating her kids. Her newest challenge is to be able to make a go of it in the high school where she will take care of the cafeteria and she has great hopes of being able to get ahead with her newest project.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale supplies and another washing machine.  She is also going to start a cafeteria in a high shool near her home.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P., 60 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 9 adult-aged children. She has been involved in farming for more than forty years already. At her age, she still manages to perform farming duties with the help of her husband and older children. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest around her community. She still has children who go to school and she hopes to be able to sustain their education.

Lydia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for the seeds she acquired and to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lydia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the seeds she acquired and to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old and married with six children.  Four of her children are still in school.  She has been doing beauty therapy for four years.  She also sells fabric and handbags to supplement her income.  

She is a new member of Faulu Kenya, in the Bukima lady’s group, and wants to take out her first loan of 20,000 KES.  She will use this loan to purchase beauty products and salon equipment.  She wants to invest in her business so as to get enough capital for opening a cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and salon equipment

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina F. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 51 years old. Edelina is married and has 5 grown children. To make a living, Edelina owns & operates a restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Edelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Edelina from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “PICAFLOR” se organiza para su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, tiene una mesa directiva  que dirige a la asociación, está compuesta por Presidenta, Tesorera y Secretaria de Actas. La presidenta, doña Arminda se dedica a la cerrajería.   

En el caso de la Secretaria de Actas, la señora Elizabeth, se dedica a negociar con mercadería en general, productos de temporada.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs.500 .- y actualmente ha solicitado un crédito de Bs. 2000.-, ella recibe la ayuda de su esposo para llevar adelante este negocio.

Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: costurera, venta de carne, venta de carne de oveja, cerrajería, venta de fruta, venta de salchipapa, venta de víveres y venta de comida
texts.en:
The “PICAFLOR” (Hummingbird) communal bank is organizing its second cycle in the VILLA EXALTACIÓN Focal Center. It has a governing board that leads the association that is composed of a President, Treasurer and Recording Secretary. The president is Arminda who is a locksmith. The Recording Secretary is Elizabeth. She is a general merchant who sells seasonal items. Her first loan was for Bs.500 and she is currently requesting Bs.2000. Her husband helps her with the business. The members of the communal bank are seven women and one man. They have a variety of businesses like: seamstress services, meat sales, lamb meat sales, locksmith services, fruit sales, salchipapas (fried potatoes and fried sausages) sales, grocery and prepared food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For merchandise.

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame Fatimata Dikel B., debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.

Elle fait du commerce de fruits, de  légumes, et de poissons. Elle fait aussi de l’embouche ovine. Pour le commerce de fruits, de légumes et de poisson elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire du village. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille. Elle cherche également à renforcer son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Xalaat was created on December 5, 2007. It is made up of 11 women who are all from the same village. The group members know each other through friendship and neighborly ties. The group is part of the SIWAL Banc Villageois. Mrs. Fatimata Dikel B., standing at the far right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells fruits, vegetables, and fish. She also fattens sheep. She buys her fruit, vegetables, and fish at the weekly markets. Her goal is to contribute to handling the family's expenses. She would also like to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 33-year old married man and has 3 young children. He is the main income provider for his family. He has fifteen years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2000. He cultivates all types of vegetables and fruits depending on the season. He also uses plastic tents to grow his products and to better monitor product quality during the year. And he delivers the harvests using a small pick-up truck to the local agriculture markets in his town. He works independently in his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. In the future, he is planning to purchase a bigger pick-up truck to further expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more stationery supplies and books

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo C., 56, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. C. produces traditional hummocks to sell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Two of her children are employed, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.

C. is now requesting her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia, for USD 1200 to open a beauty salon. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon

loans.name: Umarhon

texts.ru: Каримов Умархон проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин со смешенным ассортиментом. В этом бизнесе ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Umarhon K. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 50 years old, married and has 3 children.  He has a secondary education.  Umarhon has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years.  He has a store with various merchandise.  His wife helps him with this business.  Umarhon is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.  He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en San Francisco Gotera,  departamento de Morazán, es un lugar cercano a donde él vive y lleva ya un año de dedicarse a este negocio. Él vive con su esposa pero solamente él está al frente de la administración del negocio.
El quiere realizar una remodelación al negocio y para hacerla realidad solicita un préstamo pues no tiene los fondos necesarios para comprar los materiales para pintarlo y decorarlo, él necesita cambiar la apariencia al local para tener una  mayor atracción de los clientes y se sientan más cómodos.
Como administrador de su negocio él quiere volverlo fuerte y con capacidad para resolver las necesidades de los clientes ofreciendo una mejor atención y un trabajo de calidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is an enterprising young man.  He is 22 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  He works selling and repairing cell phones.  His business is located in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department which is near his home.  He has been in this business for a year.  He lives with his wife but he is the only one in charge of the business.

He would like to remodel his business and in order to do so he is requesting a loan as he doesn't have the necessary funds to buy the materials to paint and decorate it.  He needs to change the appearance of his premises so that he can attract more customers and so that his customers feel more comfortable.

As manager of his business, he would like to strengthen it and ensure it can fulfil his customers' needs, offering better service and quality work.

loans.use: To buy paint and decorations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Mirgia Guadalupe

texts.es:
la sra. Mirgia R. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a los servicios de cortes de pelo, aplicacion de tintes, secados de cabello, colorantes, rayitos, pedicure y manicure etc.
tiene un salon de belleza en su casa de habitacion,  la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinas, así mismo recibe otros ingresos por la venta de productos por catalogo Avon, Vogue y Lovely, compra al por mayor y la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargo, también elabora y vende Nacatamales los fines de semana.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cosmeticos y otros materiales para su salon de belleza.
esta es la mejor temporada y no quiere dejar de vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirgia Rodríguez, 52, lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood and is a hair stylist.  She cuts hair, colors hair, dries hair, applies color, does highlights, manicures, pedicures, etc.

She has a beauty salon in her home.  Most of her customers are her neighbors.  She earns extra income selling Avon, Vogue and Lovely brand catalogue items.  She buys at wholesale and most of her sales are based on orders.  She also makes Nacatamales (Nicaraguan-style tamales popular as weekend fare) on weekends.

She will use the loan to buy cosmetics and other supplies for her beauty salon.

This is the best season and she doesn’t want to stop selling to her customers.

loans.use: To buy dyes, shampoo, hair conditioner, hair treatment ampules, hair clippers, creams, perfumes.

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es:
Carmen Beatriz C. P. tiene 47 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Carmen  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es Comprar Terrenos y una casa.

Le gusta celebrar la navidad y le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
Carmen Beatriz C. P. is 47 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the San Miguel canton in the province of Bolívar. She has two children.

The members of the V.R.C. SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the San Miguel canton. They work as farmers to generate a family income, planting corn and a few potatoes and beans.

Carmen is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes. She stocks up in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells her produce at the San Miguel market on Thursdays.

She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies. With the support of this loan, she would have the financial help needed to provide for her basic needs. There are challenges to be faced, such as pests and diseases and the changes in climate. It is her dream is to buy land and a house.

She likes to celebrate Christmas and she likes sewing.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng V. D. is a 31-year-old rural villager living in Kompong Cham Province. She makes a living by sewing in a garment factory and earns a fixed salary to contribute to the family’s expenses. Her husband is a construction worker in a mobile village and he earns about $3.50 each day. The couple has three children, all of whom are single and studying at school. Heng V. D. would like a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to farm

loans.name: Miguel Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Guillermo T. R. vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ellos tienen 16 años de vivir en si hogar. El señor Miguel Guillermo labora en una agencia aduanal en el puesto de despachador, el ya tiene un poco mas de diez años trabajando ahí y percibe muy buenos ingresos los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Don  Miguel Guillermo está solicitando un préstamo para terminar los acabados del exterior de la casa   
Estas mejoras a su vivienda permitirán que el señor Miguel Guillermo y su familia puedan vivir más cómodamente.
Esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual podo terminar el cuarto y el baño de sus hijos.  Espera contar nuevamente con su cooperación en este préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel Guillermo T. R. lives with his wife and two children.  They have lived in their home for 16 years.  Miguel Guillermo works for a customs agency as a dispatcher.  He has been working there for a little over ten years and he makes a very good wage which he needs to support his family.

Miguel Guillermo is requesting this loan to finish off some work to the outside of his home.  These home improvements will allow him and his family to live more comfortably.  He is grateful for Kiva lenders' cooperation in his previous loan which allowed him to finish off his children's room and bathroom.  He hopes that he will be able to count on your cooperation again with this loan.

loans.use: To finish off some work to the outside of his home

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cerafina; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y fruta ella compra para luego venderlo por todo el Valle Sagrado cuando hay ferias  como Urubamba, Calca, Ollantaytambo,la socia también cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de Calca donde trabaja los días que no hay ferias , la socia es una persona bien alegre ,optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia , esta es la única actividad que ella realiza por el momento. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más verduras y frutas para su negocio y así poder abastecer a más clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LA ÑUSTA III" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Cerafina is 52 years old, married and has nine children.  She buys and sells fruit and vegetables throughout Valle Sagrado at trade fairs in Urubamba, Calca and Ollantaytambo.  She has a stall at the Calca market where she works on days when there are no fairs elsewhere.  

She is a very optimistic, happy person who works hard to earn a living for her family.  This is the only activity she is involved in for now.

She plans to use the loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business so she can keep up with customer demand.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for retail sale

loans.name: Octura Group

texts.en:
Jennifer is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez. She is 43 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or in default.

Jennifer is married and has five adult children. She owns and operates in agricultural sector in  the local community running a livestock in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jennifer joined PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital.

Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase new livesctock such as pig to expand her business. This loan will be her eleventh from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To Purchase livestock such as pig

loans.name: Rudyliza

texts.en:
Rudyliza N. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Rudyliza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rudyliza owns & operates a business buying and selling seafood products, including fish like sari & budlisan, and also sea shells, like guso & lato. Rudyliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rudyliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudyliza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and sea shells to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rudyliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and sea shells to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy napkins, corn, beans, thread, needles, embroidery hoops, beads, pins, etc.

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Vinh T. D. is 50 years old with five children. Three of them are married and she is providing education for the other two. She has done farming since her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice and vegetables and raising chickens for meat. Some of these agricultural products are used to support her family and the rest are sold to get money for other spending. 

Since becoming a client of our credit program in 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farming. Because of this, her loan size is higher year after year. Now, she needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

Anh T. D. is 35 years old. She sells flowers in the local market. She needs to have 4,142,000 VND to buy more kinds of flowers to meet  her customers' demand.
  
Hang T. H. is 30 years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to improve a house for them.
 
Lan T. H. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer for the next crop

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth S. is a 31-year-old married woman who has been earning a daily income by working at the garment factory. She is able to get a fixed salary from her job of around $1.50 per day. Beside this work, she has also been planting rice which is her annual business. Her husband is a sour palm juice seller in Baray district. 

Yeth S. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to pay for plowing which she has hired out before and to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Yeth S. has three children who are attending school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 38 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años vende ropa y calzados, mercadería que ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amistades mas cercanas a su vivienda. Es así que diariamente visita a las amistades y gana confianza con nueva gente, amigos de sus amigos, lo cual va formando así una cadena, lo cual es ventajoso para su negocio. Los productos que tiene los da a crédito y el tiempo de pago va de acuerdo al plazo que ha convenido con sus clientes, por tal razón siempre es muy organizada en sus cuentas. Gracias a su buena administración ha logrado crecer el capital que tiene y establecerse económicamente. Por ahora se dedicará a esta actividad con miras a establecerse en un puesto de ventas. Es su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar nueva mercadería, para viajará a la ciudad de Lima para adquirirlos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 38 years old and lives together with her husband and two children in her own home.  She has been selling clothes and footwear for eight years and makes her sales door to door to her neighbors and friends who live close by.  Every day she visits her friends and gains the trust of new people, friends of friends.  In this way, she gradually creates a chain which is profitable for her business.  Lourdes provides her products on credit and collects payment in accordance with the time-frame she has agreed upon with her customers.  For this reason, she is always very organized in her accounts.  Thanks to her good management of her business, Lourdes has managed to increase the capital that she has and settle herself financially.  For now, she is working in her business with a view to setting up a sales location.

This is Lourdes' 10th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and has always shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to all the people who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying new merchandise which she will travel to the city of Lima to purchase.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in the city of Lima

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are currently attending school.

John has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya for the last 37 years. His main products are maize, milk, pineapples and bananas, which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

John has requested a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 52,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help in the education of his children and improve their living standards as well. 

He hopes to practice dairy farming in large scale in the next five years in order to cut costs and improve his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De La F Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Vicenta   es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente es integrante en L. alcancía comunal “Las Emprendedoras D. L. F” grupo  conformado por 8   socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Vicenta  trabaja desD. hace  10 años  en su propia bodega  donD. venD. dulces, abarrotes etc.  elL. empezó vendiendo algunos productos, tiempo después pudo ampliar su negocio, Nos cuenta que nada fue fácil porque trabajo muy duro junto a su esposo , pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos cuentan  con educación y sobretodo tienen una mejor calidad D. vida , Vicenta nos cuenta que como mujer se siente muy orgullosa e independiente, El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería, dulces, arroz azúcar leche y demás abarrotes . Sabemos que Vicenta  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Mrs. Vicenta has a common-law husband and four children.  She is in the communal bank "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS D. L. F", which is comprised of eight members who are merchants in different activities.  For ten years Vicenta has been running her own store where she sells sweets, groceries, etc.  She started out selling only a few products, but later expanded her business.  She says it has not been easy for her and her husband who, through their joint effort and dedication, have been able to improve their income.  Their children are getting an education and have a better lifestyle.  Vicenta says she feels very proud to be an independent woman.  She will use the loan to buy goods such as sweets, rice, sugar, milk and other groceries.  We know that Vicenta will reach her goals with a lot of work and effort, and the Edaprospo loans will help in that regard.

loans.use: To buy goods (sweets and groceries).

loans.name: Samaritano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Samaritano está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Virginia Alejandra de 49 años quien inicio realizando tortillas y con los prestamos decidió invertir en la venta de nacatamales, comida típica a base de masa y cerdo. Ella con el crédito comprará materia prima para su negocio esto es cerdo, maíz, especie, leña, hojas…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Ángela Francisca quien inicio en la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde muy joven ya que le ayudaba a su mamá y desde hace tres años se independizo y Osmar Antonio es agricultor e invertirá el crédito en poner una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The Samaritano group has three members who are hard-working, determined and entrepreneurial.  The group's coordinator is 49 year-old Virginia Alejandra who started out selling tortillas and, with the help of loans, decided to invest in selling nacatamales (traditional food made from dough and pork).  She will use her loan to buy raw materials for her business such as pork, corn, spices, firewood, leaves (for wrapping the nacatamales in), etc.

The other members of the group are Ángela Francisca, who started out selling fruit and vegetables in Masaya market when she was very young as she used to help her mom (three years ago she started working for herself), and Osmar Antonio who is a farmer and will invest his loan in setting up a small sales location.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, pork, spices, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Everth Jose

texts.es: Everth José se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 42 años, es un hombre muy trabajador. Inicio este medio de vida cuando no tenía el medio de ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y necesitaba proporciónale el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar cada día sus ingresos pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y proporcionar lo necesario.
texts.en: Everth Jose owns a store. He is 42 years old and a very hard working man. He started his business when he didn't have the necessary income to support his family and feed them every day. The reason for the funding request is to buy staples such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, juices, sodas and more. He dreams of  improving  his income  day after day  because  he has always enjoyed working and offering what's needed.

loans.use: to buy sweets, detergents, basic grains, juices, sodas and more.

loans.name: Karem Lisbeth

texts.es:
Karen Lisbeth tiene 20 años, Es soltera vive con la madre no tiene hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Karen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es algun dia cultivar cacao y poner una fabrica de cafe.

Le gusta escuchar musica y bailar.
texts.en:
Karen Lisbeth is 20 years and single.  She doesn't have any children and lives with her mother in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing crops such as corn and rice.

Karen is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Karen is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially meet her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests and a lack of money to pay more workers.  Her dream is to some day grow cacao and set up a coffee factory.

Karen enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Mrs. Chhan, age39, earns an income by selling many vegetables in one wooden store near her village in Chey Chor district.  Her husband is a rice farmer, and he generates his income by planting crops every year. They have given birth to three kids; one of the children is working as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh and is getting a formal salary each month. Mrs. Chhan would like to request a loan to pay for medical fees.

loans.use: to pay for medical/doctor fees

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Alicia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like pants, blouses, foot-wear etc. to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like pants, blouses, foot-wear etc. to sell

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El Sr. Abraham es  una persona  muy  trabajadora y  responsable el  cual  tiene  un taller  de  costura  el  cual  le permite  salir  adelante  día  con día, gracias a  su empeño y  dedicación  su  cartera de clientes a ido  aumentando  considerablemente y  consiguió un  contrato  con una  secundaria de la   localidad,  el cual  consite  en  realizar   los uniformes  de la  institución, es  por  ello   que    acudió   con  nosotros  para  apoyarlo en la realización de  su proyecto el cual consite  en  la  compra  de  mercancía  ,  ve  en el  crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio   y a  su vez  obtener  mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Abraham is a very hardworking, responsible person who has a sewing workshop that allows him to get ahead daily.  Thanks to his dedication and hard work his customer portfolio has been growing considerably and he secured a contract with a local secondary school to make the institute’s uniforms.  Because of this, he called on us for support for his project which consists in purchasing merchandise.  He sees in the loan the possibility of making his business grow while simultaneously earning higher income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria Alicia

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 34 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Ibarra; Gloria se desribe como una persona trabajadora y honrada.

Trabaja con dos personas tejiendo sacos de lana, es la segunda vez que le solicita créditos a FODEMI, el crédito va a utilizar en la compra de lana para tejer sus sacos lo cual le ayudará a incrementar su producción y sus ventas y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder exportar los sacos que teje.
texts.en:
Gloria, 34, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ibarra. Gloria describes herself as hardworking and honorable.

She works with two other people weaving wool bags. This is her second time requesting a loan from FODEMI. She will use the loan to buy wool to make the sacks which will help her increase her production and her sales and thereby improve her quality of life.

Her dream is that this business grows and she is able to export her bags.

loans.use: buy wool to weave bags.

loans.name: Zinnatkhan's Group

texts.en:
Zinnatkhan is the leader of this group. She is 32 and brings up three children. Her husband works in Russia and the children study at school. Sixteen years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zinnatkhan started to breed livestock. At the moment, she keeps a cow with a calf and 15 sheep. In case she needs money to meet the family needs, she can sell some animals.  With money received from the loan, Zinnatkhan wants to purchase three more sheep to increase the number of livestock. In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to repair her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 26-year-old businessman. He is married to Irene, who is employed. They have no children yet. He has been selling new clothes for the past four years with the monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Henry will use the loan to buy more clothes for his business stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand it. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop that will give him good income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his business stock.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” y las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq (Provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco).

El socio Leoncio nació en la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis,  él tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos; el socio Leoncio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra de carros usados para luego desarmarlos y después vender sus partes como chatarra en una feria sabatina.  

El socio Leoncio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio de chatarrería.

El socio Leoncio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Leoncio, 44, belongs to the “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” communal bank which meets monthly in Wanchaq (Cusco Province and Department).  He was born in the city of Urcos in Quispicanchis Province.  He’s in a common law relationship and has three children.  He alternates his daily chores with a business buying used cars to dismantle and sell the parts as junk metal in a Saturday market.  He’s asking for the loan to buy more merchandise for his recycled metal business.  Leoncio is happy with the loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy more material for his junk metal business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and the father of one child. 

Sabah is a blacksmith. In 2007, he opened a workshop making doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas. Sabah is requesting a loan of $1800 to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 50-year-old mixed crop farmer, is married to Mary, a business lady, and they are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years. He has been in the business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

After being introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member, Joseph is applying for his third loan which he will use to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig-rearing to further improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old and married with five children. 

To make a living, Jennifer is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many more. Jennifer has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Jennifer is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Vaiola

texts.en:
Vaiola, 51, is a married mother of four children.

Vaiola owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Vaiola needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 WST or US $83 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Vaiola joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Vaiola's second loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (The higher the number, the better off the person is.) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score.  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Herminia Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Herminia es un persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado en su casa de habitación, es separada y con tres hijos de los cuales ninguno dependen de ella actualmente ya que estos son mayores de edad. Es primera vez que solicita préstamo con ceprodel para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 
A gradece a ceprodel por la oportunidad brindada ya que ahora contara con mejor inventario en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Herminia is a hardworking person who makes her living selling clothing and shoes in her home. She is separated and has three children, who are all independent adults. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with CEPRODEL to purchase merchandise for her business.

She thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity provided to her because now she will have better inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: La Confianza Group

texts.es:
La señora Ingrid Maritza es casada, tiene, 21 años de edad, cursó el sexto año de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica al comercio a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, inicia la venta de otros artículos en la tienda, vendiendo trastos de cocina, lo cual lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de artículos de plastifico para venderlos en la tienda que tiene, baldes, palanganas, cepillos, escobas, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, venta de plásticos y artículos de plástico, atención atienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ingrid Maritza is married, 21 years old and has finished the sixth grade of primary school. She has two children. She sells articles of daily living. When she began her retail business, she sold kitchen supplies. She has six years of experience selling these supplies with her husband, who is a businessman.
She began this lending group in order to ask for a loan. She will use this loan to buy plastic articles which she will sell in her store. She will buy buckets, wash basins, brushes, brooms, etc. The other members of the group raise animals, sell plastic goods or sell goods for daily living.

loans.use: buy plastic articles to sell.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem is 31-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray district and earns a living by selling many different kinds of toys in various towns. She earns $2.50 a day to meet her family’s needs and help pay the cost of sending her one child to a local primary school. Yem wants to improve her living standards by helping her husband provide transportation services by driving a tuck-tuck (or small motorized vehicle). She is applying for this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a tuck tuck for her husband. She hopes to use the additional income earned by her family to expand and improve her toy-selling business.

loans.use: to buy a tuck tuck for her husband.

loans.name: Juana Santa

texts.es: Juana está casada y tiene 45 años. Tiene un hijo de 5 años que asiste a la escuela fiscal. Toda la vida ha vivido en Libertad, nos dice que no podría cambiar su residencia porque le gusta mucho su ciudad. Santiago el esposo de Juana se dedica a la artesanía, así fue como se conocieron ya que ella anteriormente realizaba tejidos con paja toquilla, un producto muy popular en Libertad. Junto a su esposo tomaron la decisión de emprender un negocio ahorrando y prestando dinero. Ahora tiene una tienda que maneja sola desde muy temprano, su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa. Su inconveniente principal es la temporada invernal por la lluvia. Nos cuenta que como su tienda esta echa de caña se inunda y moja sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, colas etc. productos de primera necesidad. Su meta es construir su local de cemento.
texts.en: Juana is 45 years old and married. She has a 5-year-old son who attends public school. She has lived in Libertad all her life and she tells us that she couldn't change her residence because she likes her town very much. Juana's husband Santiago makes crafts. That's how they met, since she used to weave fabrics using toquilla straw, which is a very popular product in Libertad. Along with her husband she decided to start a business saving and lending money. She currently owns a store, which she manages by herself from the early hours of the morning. Her husband currently sells clothing. Her main inconvenience is wintertime, because of the rain. She tells us that, since her store is made of cane, it floods and wets her merchandise. She requests the loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, olive oil, soft drinks, essential goods, etc. Her goal is to build a store made of cement.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and olive oil.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija; ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas, zanahoria, plátanos. Papayas, naranjas, melones, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar con este negocio y se ha  hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener siempre las  mejores ganancias, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de la localidad donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, fresco, con buenos precios pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; María Guadalupe es una mujer visionaria, con muchas metas por lograr, quiere un futuro más próspero  y piensa esforzarse al máximo hasta alcanzarlo; quiere aumentar sus ventas por lo tanto necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar verduras y frutas por mayor. María Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura poder pagar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.

loans.use: verduras y frutas por mayor

loans.name: Wangnignigbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNIGBE 2 est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Ablawa, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Stache. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ablawa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Ablawa a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Ablawa vend des vivres depuis une dizaine d’année. Ablawa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Ablawa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNIGBE 2 un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en: Zubeda is 24 years old. She is not married, is a mother of one child, and lives with her parents in Kilolo district. She is responsible in taking care of her child as well as supporting her siblings by paying their school fees and household expenses. Zubeda is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students. She requested a Kiva loan to start a poultry business near her village. She will use her profit obtained from the loan to buy chicken food and pay for household expenses for her family.

loans.use: to start a poultry business

loans.name: Nadjegueton 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe NADJEGUETON 5 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
