Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
Ils sont à leur 7ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Monsieur Mamoutou en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo,  il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 690.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Reina Cristina

texts.en:
My name is Reyna Cristina, I have a store where I sell clothes and shoes. It’s located in one of the busiest neighborhoods in the city. I have several years in this type of activity. With the income I am able to provide my children with education and pay for the family’s expenses. I’d like to stock up my store since Christmas is coming up, and in this season sales are a lot higher.

Loan Use: Purchase clothes, shoes, and beauty products.

Mi Nombre es ReYna Cristina, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado,ubicado en uno de los barrios mas transitados de esta ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para dar educacion a mis hijos y cubrir los gastos familiares, deseo surtir bien mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad en es la epoca de mayor venta

loans.use: Compra de Ropa, Calzado y Productos de Belleza

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would wish to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Muattarhon

texts.en:
Muattarhon has a small sewing workshop in Khujand. She is married and has one pretty girl. She has a high level of education as a designer of leather clothes. She has been in this business for over 9 years. She became a client of Micro Invest in 2005. She has been able to expand her business with loans provided by Micro Invest.

As leather goods are in demand only in wintertime, Muattarhon decided to add other services to her business. These services include sewing cloaks and jackets for the spring and autumn seasons from fabrics other than leather. In the summer season she sews traditional dresses from summer fabrics, so she always has a good turnover in her business. She has many assistants who help her in her business. Muattarhon would like to use her next loan to purchase beautiful summer fabrics from China.

P.S. In the photo you can see Muattarhon, in the center, with her assistants.

loans.use: Purchase of summer fabric

loans.name: Kouadio

texts.en: Kouadio A. Christine is a single mother.  she is 37 and lives with her 2 children in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She sells cooked cassava in the Port-Bouët open market and has a lot of customers among the tradeswomen in the market who take their lunch near their businesses. She has 11 years of work experience in this business and is very dynamic. She is very happy as it’s her second consecutive year she gets a loan from AE&I for the payment of the school fees and tuitions for her children. Christine children who are both in secondary school will resume school in September 2007 and she will use the loan to pay for their education.

loans.use: Kouadio Amenan will use the loan to pay school fees and tuition for her 2 children

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat S., age 47, works with her husband to grow vegetables on their plot of land and sell them in the market, earning around $1 per day. They have six children. One child works selling rice and fruit in the market, earning around $7 per day in revenue. Three of Mrs. Khat’s children work alongside her son-in-law, who earns about $9 per day in revenue from his blacksmith business. The other two children are students.

Khat would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase additional blacksmith tools so her family can take on larger, more lucrative commissions to meet clients' demands. She would also like to use the money to rent a proper shop so the business can attract more customers in town. The additional income projected to come from this business expansion will help finance her younger children’s education and increase the standard of living for her family. She is pictured with her husband in their home.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools and open a blacksmith shop

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a mother of eight children, seven girls and one boy. My husband is a blacksmith and I am a seamstress. I create different kinds of ladies clothes and cheap diapers for children. I started this business a couple of years ago by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. With that loan I bought a sewing machine, which allowed me to increase production and satisfy my clients. Now I wish to expand my business and buy a large quantity of cloth and threads. Please lend me $350. I am sure this loan will give me economic security and will allow me to save for my children’s future.

loans.use: Buy cloth and threads in bulk

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a 23-year-old daughter. She and her family live in Izyum. Svetlana works in the Kolkhoznyi market near the train station. She sells fresh pork meat which is always in demand, as Ukrainian cuisine is famous for its delicious pork dishes. Svetlana has been in this business for 20 years. After being unemployed for quite awhile, she was looking for job opportunities and decided to start her own business selling pork meat in the local market. Svetlana knows how hard it is to earn the money. She puts in many long hours to get the job done and make sure her business achieves its full potential. She realizes this business is very competitive but is ready to make the effort to succeed and come out on top. She admits she has benefited a lot from the financial assistance she has received through Nadiya Ukraine. Presently, her net profit from her business is about $600-1000 per month. 

Today Svetlana is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Josephine and Dorothy both sell charcoal for a living. With the extra business profits, Josephine intends to pay school fees for her children. Mariam and Grace have retail businesses and want to use the loan to increase the stock in their shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen Comenzó en el mes de Febrero de 1993 a vender joyería , zapatos y otros artículos por catálogo, a raíz de que un agente de ventas la visitó su casa y al cual le platicó su inquietud de poner un pequeño negocio y gracias a la asesoría que le brindó pudo iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra-venta de joyería. Posteriormente cambió de giro al vender ropa nueva con la cual le fue muy bien y hace 2 años comenzó a vender además de la ropa nueva zapatos por catalogo y lencería. Carmen trabaja para poder sacar dinero para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijas, las cuales una de ellas ya terminó, pero las dos más pequeñas se encuentran estudiando la preparatoria.

Sin embargo Actualmente, Carmen está solicitando un crédito de US $825 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Carmen podrá comprar un lote de zapatos de temporada y lencería que le permita tener un mayor surtido para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Carmen podrá salir adelante y ofrecerles una carrera universitaria a sus dos hijas.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
My name is Martha R.. I have been married for 30 years and have four children: two girls and two boys. I reside with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband works at Pakistan Railways and in the evening drives a rickshaw to supplement his income. Now, one of my sons also plans to buy a separate rickshaw, which he will drive after his office hours; hence we require a loan.

The members of my group will also share in this loan: Tania S., who needs a loan for her family’s paint business; Nazia F., who is borrowing to fix her husband’s taxi; Usha V., who sews clothes, and Farzana B., who will use her share to get their rickshaw repaired.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw
